results.description:
[EVENT IS FULL, RSVP IS CLOSED]
(location will be emailed to qualified registrants)

Join us for this fun-filled CTO Breakfast event exclusively for CTOs, CIOs, IT Leadership and equivalent Sr. Tech-Executives. This totally free event will include a sumptuous breakfast, ample networking with CTOs and stimulating intellectual discussion about modern cloud-based applications and how to overcome the constraints of traditional database infrastructure.

We will also feature a presentation from Seth Proctor, NuoDB CTO, who will discuss how modern applications require a database that can:

- Span multiple geographies / data centers
- Deliver elasticity
- Provide high performance even with heavy application usage
- Offer around-the-clock resiliency and uptime

Seth will lead an interactive discussion about ways that organizations like yours are meeting the challenges associated with building new cloud-apps or migrating existing applications to the cloud.

Featured Speaker: Seth Proctor, CTO, NuoDB


Seth has 15+ years of experience in the research, design and implementation of scalable systems. His particular focus is on how to make technology scale and how to make users scale effectively with their systems.

* Please note: this is an exclusive event for CTOs, senior IT leaders and technology-executives/VPs. Venue location will only be provided to qualified-attendees after we verify your registration.

My wife went back to work this week so I'm home with my 3 month old.  I'll be kicking off the weekly dads meetups for the group again. Generally, we'll meet on a Tuesday or Thursday morning and take advantage of a park, museum, or playground when it's less crowded during a weekday morning.  Hope you can join us!

This week we'll meet at the Central Park Zoo.  Admission is pricey, but we're members so we're able to get in a guest + kids for free.  The zoo opens at 10:00am and is extremely accessible for strollers.  We'll plan to hit the Penguin House, Sea Lion Show, and petting zoo.

results.description:
Make simple, powerful portraits with one light. As portrait photographers, we find or create light to help tell the story of our subject. 

Classic portraits commonly use 3 point lighting and while this is great, often times a simple one light set-up can tell the story just as well.

Join Daniel Norton On Set as he shows you why sometimes simple is better.

Learning to master a single light set-up is useful for shooting on location, where you don't have the time or space for a full set-up. We will explore both studio style images and environmental portraits where you work with the light in your location and add a single key light to control color and quality on your subject.

Learn: How one light can act as 3 with a little creative placement.

Learn: Various go-to modifiers for the one light portrait shooter.

Learn: Techniques for both Speedlight and Large flash portraiture.

There will be three sessions, each covering different modifiers.

Sign up for one or all

12pm, 2pm and 4pm

Daniel Norton is the Creative Director for Adorama with over 15 years experience as a Photographer, Director and DP in the advertising and editorial markets. Daniel also produces and hosts FREE weekly in-store trainings for Adorama every Thursday as well as the Adorama TV series On Set with Daniel Norton.
results.name: FREE Demo! OnSet Day: Create Stunning Portraits with One Light

results.description:
Join this special free LIVE online event from across the world.

With meditation and visualisation, this powerful 30 minute broadcast features beautiful sounds and music to uplift, energise and inspire.

Experience the benefit of the enhanced collective energy of meditating with other people, whilst being in the comfort of your own home or office.

Each meditation includes an introduction, followed by a time in which to meditate in whatever way is easy and natural to you.

You are then guided through a visualisation enabling you to focus on living your ideal life.

 

Participating Live:

The broadcast begins promptly at 2.00pm and finishes at 2.30pm.

***Please click to join Meditation 101 Live at the scheduled broadcast time ***

Please note that the meditation and visualisation are pre-recorded to ensure sound quality however participation with other people from across the world is live.

Meditation 101 Live works best with the following internet browsers: Internet Explorer, Chrome, Safari and Opera.

If you need any technical help connecting to Meditation 101 Live please click here.

Testimonials:

"That was absolutely amazing! I don't think I have ever fully let go and quieted my mind like that before. I feel so inspired. By the end of the session I was filled with so much love - love for myself, for others, and love coming from Source. Unconditional, pure love. Thank you." C.L.

"Instead of the 'knowledge gained', I find it appropriate to give a 5 star to 'raising my vibrations' during the meditation.... the energy of the group was Amazing and ZINGING! Thanks... " - S

"Thank you Tracy for a wonderful start to the day. Amazing calmness capturing everyone's energy on the class. Look forward to attending the next on-line class. Thank you." - B.J

"Very enlightening and a positive way for those that can't make it physically to do so remotely.""Thank you, the second section moved me the most. I had a real moment of knowing who I was, am and always be. Also, I have in the past trained in yoga and meditation but not practiced for a number of years - I felt all the beauty of it flowing connecting through my source once again aaaahhh bliss." - A.S.

"Truly inspirational, loved it, thank you ." - Anonymous

"Really loved being able to just switch on and meditate." - L.M.

"So relaxing and cleansing." - T.H.

"Awesome meditation Tracy! One of the most powerful sessions I have ever had. Wow." - G.R.

"I absolutely loved the meditation. The music was one that I truly enjoyed. Thank you so much for this. Many blessings to you." - S.

FOR DETAILS OF ALL UPCOMING 'MEDITATION 101 LIVE' SESSIONS PLEASE CLICK HERE.

Follow Meditation 101 Live on Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn.

results.description:
Meet at 4:00 pm.

Ride at 4:15 pm

IF A SECOND GROUP WANTS TO MEET AT 5:30, I will designate a location on the trail so we can be one group.

Meet at small parking lot off of College Road (University Drive.)

Intermediate level ride; no beginners please.

Most fun trails are unmarked.  Ride is not super fast. May ride to the top depending upon group.

Map of Park: http://www.wpunj.edu/dotAsset/325914.pdf

Park Website: http://www.nynjtc.org/park/high-mountain-park-preserve

A description from mtbNJ "with lots of loose rock, and rock garden too and lots of climbing, lesser flowy trails hence the rocks. This trails will make you hate or love. There's some nice single track too."

Note:  Can get there from Hamburg Tpk in Wayne to University Drive  at a light (Turn left) or

From 287 to Route 208 S, Take Ewing Ave Exit and travel S to T (stop sign), Turn L onto High Mt Road.  Stay on High Mt Road to fork, keep right to stay on High Mt Road.   At next traffic light, make a right.  At stop sign, this is College Road, turn right.  Parking lot is up a ways on the right.
results.how_to_find_us: Red Trail Parking Lot on College Road (University Drive.)
results.name: After work at High Mt. Preserve - Intermediate Ride

results.description:
IMPORTANT: This meetup is contingent upon people RSVPing. If there are no RSVP's, the meetup will not happen. The likelihood of this is very low, but please RSVP no matter. Also, time and location can change if there is support to do so, thus please make suggestions if you desire.

Manhattanites and others who reside in greater New York City! Come enjoy some casual Magic the Gathering gameplay in a casual environment. Here is an example of a typical Mastermind:

5:30pm – Open mix and mingle (15 minutes)

5:45-6:30pm – Group business needs requests/Mastermind (45 minutes)

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
It's time to get kicking. Kick your neighbor. Kick your brother. Kick the big red ball. Just don't kick your dog. Game. On.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of kickball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game with rules similar to baseball -- except instead of using a bat to hit a little ball, you use your feet to kick a ball about 10x the size of a baseball. Kick the ball, run to the base, avoid getting your ball caught mid-air or yourself tagged out. Easy. And no athletic skill is necessary, just the ability to kick! Go out and practice now to get ready. Kick the postman when he delivers your bills. Kick that neighbor who won't turn down his stereo. Just get kicking!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/64476072/Kickball%20Rules.pdf.</a>

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be kicking and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.

results.description:
All Bisexual, Non-monosexual, and all other Queer-identified and Bi-friendly people are invited to come join people from the greater NYC Area in a lively topic oriented discussion at BiRequest's famously open, non-judgmental, safe space. If you can't make it to the meeting, feel free to join everyone afterward around  "eight-fifteenish" for dinner.

about us: Thanks to the dedication and hard work of many good bisexual folk, BiRequest is a bisexual social discussion group serving the New York City metropolitan area since January 1994. We provide a safe space for bisexuals and bi-friendly people to gather and discuss issues of importance to us.

We're a co-ed group for adults from 18 to 80-plus who meet twice a month every 1st and 3rd Thursday evening at NYC's LGBT Center in the West Village. The meetings are moderated and focused on a discussion topic but not limited to that week's topic.

After the discussion group session, at 8 o'clock we go to dinner at a nearby, reasonably-priced restaurant for socializing and more informal discussion. We also have occasional social events such as movie nights, parties, and much more. Join us for a meeting or event and find the community you've been looking for!

People who can't make it to the meeting are invited to join our private online group BiRequest on Yahoo or on our Facebook Page BiRequest on Facebook.

results.description:
Agenda:


6:00 - 6:15pm: security check-in
6:15 - 7:30pm: talks (see below for speaker bios and abstracts)
7:30 - 8:30pm: food & networking

Note: this event is for anyone who identifies as a woman.



Dr. Sameena Shah is a Director of Research for Thomson Reuters and heads the R&D NY site. Prior to this role, she worked at a StatArb hedge fund in NYC, and a startup. Sameena is a cofounder of Cocoa Compassion, a social enterprise. Sameena holds a PhD in Machine Learning from IIT Delhi, which was judged as the top one for India for 2010 by Microsoft Research. She holds a Masters in Computer Applications and B.Tech in Electronics Engineering. Sameena has published more than 20 papers and is on the review panel of major CS/EE journals and conferences.

Abstract: How do you find out what is happening in the world ? Traditionally, the answer has been traditional media organizations. However, these days most people will agree that Twitter has become a big part of the news generation and dissemination process. While Twitter is being used, however the process of news discovery is almost universally rudimentary; limited to searching using keywords that one may think of. Thomson Reuters R&D along with our Reuters news division, has built a ground up technology that automates the news discovery process from social sources. Sameena, who led the research and development of this product, will highlight the machine learning and NLP algorithms contribution in this breakthrough technology.

Joyce Shen is the Director of Emerging Technology Partnerships & Investments at Thomson Reuters. She leads the enterprise CTO efforts on emerging technology trends, partnerships, and investments globally.  Before joining Thomson Reuters, Joyce was the founding member and CFO of the Cloud Platform Services division (Bluemix) at IBM.  Joyce holds bachelor’s degrees in Statistics and Economics from the University of Chicago and an MBA degree from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.

Abstract: Thomson Reuters emerging tech team identifies emerging tech trends and helps form tech innovation partnerships to help Thomson Reuters and startups to reach new markets.  Joyce will share her perspective on corporate innovation and emerging tech trends in B2B space.
results.name: Data Science and Emerging Technology at Thomson Reuters

results.description:
COME BREAK UP THE WORK WEEK AND JOIN US FOR A SUNSET MOUNTAIN BIKE RIDE AT MOHONK PRESERVE.

Please arrive by 6:00pm at the West Trapps Parking Lot to allow time to prep your bike and gear so that we may depart promptly by 6:15pm.

Starting from the West Trapps Lot we will Follow Undercliff Road to the Rhododendron Bridge.  We will cross over and take a right onto Oakwood Drive.  Next we take a sharp left onto Kleine Kill Road, then a left on Forest Drive, another left on Lake Shore Road and a right onto Long Woodland Drive which will take us to Humpty Dumpty Lane.

At Humpty Dumpty Lane we will stop at one of the Gazebos and take in the breathtaking views before our descent down Laurel Ledge Road and head back to West Trapps via Overcliff Road.

Please note: Our route may change slightly depending on the groups abilities, remaining daylight and enthusiasm levels. The addition of Duck Pond is an option that will cover more elevation if the group is up to it.


Distance: Approximately 12-13 miles

Estimated Bike Time: 2 hours

Difficulty: Advanced Beginner / Intermediate - Gravel Carriage Roads with some Steep Hills

Current Weather Forecast: Mostly Sunny with a high of 81 degrees

 MANDATORY GEAR:

• Mountain Bike or Hybrid

• Bicycle Helmet

• Headlamp with spare batteries

RECOMMENDED GEAR:

• Clear eye Protection (safety glasses - for bugs, dirt, etc.)

• Related maps, a compass or GPS, Water, Snacks, First Aid, etc.

• Bike Pump

• Tire Patch Kit and/or Spare Tube

PLEASE INSPECT YOUR BIKE PRIOR TO ARRIVAL TO INSURE THE FOLLOWING:

• Proper Tire Inflation

• Lubricated chain

• Properly Shifting gears

• Functional Brakes that don't rub rim or tire when released.

In Fairness to the group, anyone having trouble once we reach the Rhododendron Bridge will be asked to go back on the Overcliff Trail which is still a fun and scenic but shorter loop.

WHERE TO MEET?

West Trapps Parking Area - Mohonk Preserve

[masked],[masked]


RELATED MAPS:

New York - New Jersey Trail Conference - Shawangunk Trails Map Set

(Specifically Trail Maps 105 & 106)

Also check this link for a .pdf of Mohonk's own Bicycle Routes map

(Please Note: More routes have been opened up to biking since the publication of this .pdf)


Afterwards feel free to join us at Bacchus Restaurant, Bar & Billiards for some great food/drinks & maybe even a game of Pool! (Venue subject to change based on group preference)

Bacchus Restaurant

4 South Chestnut Street

New Paltz, NY 12561

results.description:
Architecture's biggest allies, and likely some of our most powerful future partners, are our colleagues in the social sciences. Collaborations with these experts yield a broad range of opportunities, possibly the most significant of which is making the invisible visible through both pure and applied research.

Over generations of design education and practice, architects have learned to use different types of information to produce buildings. Now we are entering a new era of information availability and application. How do you prove that good design is a matter of life and death? Why do architects need the social sciences, and why do social scientists need architecture? What data and research methods can make buildings that lift the human spirit? This program seeks to map out new ground for novel collaborations, particularly those with practitioners and researchers in the social sciences.

It is increasingly clear that the social sciences, which include a wide range of fields, from psychology and anthropology to sociology and data sciences, have much to contribute to our field. Join us for this discussion to learn about what these different fields are, how they contribute to architectural practice, and why it’s important that they do so.

PLEASE NOTE:  YOUR RSVP HERE IS A VOTE OF CONFIDENCE + WE APPRECIATE IT! CLICK HERE TO RSVP ($10) ON THE AIANY SITE.

This is the sixth in a series of events related to the presidential theme of Tomas Rossant, AIA, "Dialogues from the Edge of Practice." The theme intends to explore how architects are boldly enlarging the purview of the practitioner to bring their particular critical problem solving skills and design acumen to endeavors previously considered outside the traditional scope of practice. There has never been a time when the role of the architect has been more relevant as an instrument to shape culture, society, and positive environmental outcomes. “Dialogues” will engage the practitioners amongst us who are breaking rules, trying new things, and taking new risks—expanding the impact of the architect—and disseminate their experiences to our professional community.

Panelists:
Scott Francisco, Founder and Director, Pilot Projects, is a hands-on designer, strategist, and cultural theorist in New York City who focuses on infrastructure and culture in organizations and cities. As founder and director of Pilot Projects, a design and consulting firm, Scott's architecture, construction, and consulting backgrounds inform the high value he places on engaging people, culture, and craftsmanship in the design process—particularly in the midst of today's overemphasis on efficiency and quantification. Scott teaches design at Parsons The New School for Design, Kean University, and Stanford in New York, and speaks regularly on workplace, organizational culture, and sustainability. He holds architecture degrees from the University of Toronto and MIT.

Ann Devlin, Ph.D. is the May Buckley Sadowski ’19 Professor of Psychology, Connecticut College and the author of Transforming the Doctor’s Office: Principles from Evidence-based Design (Routledge, 2015), her 4th book. Most of her published work focuses on the built environment, and her recent interest is health care, including the role of the facility’s appearance in people’s judgments of expected care. She is a senior associate editor of the journal Environment and Behavior.

Co-curators:
Evie Klein is an architect and planner specializing in cultural institutions and higher education. She is currently a doctoral candidate in Environmental Psychology at CUNY focusing on how the social sciences can contribute to the design process, and particularly how spaces can promote inclusion of diverse populations. Until 2013, she was NYU’s Assistant Vice President of Planning and Design, overseeing facilities planning and space management at the University. Prior to NYU, she had a career as an architect, where she worked at Polshek Partnership Architects [now Ennead], ran her own architectural design practice, and served as an advisor for the National Design Awards at the Cooper-Hewitt National Design Museum. She received her B.A. from Vassar College and her M.Arch. from UCLA. She currently serves on the Board of Directors of the Center for Architecture, the Advisory Board of NYU’s Of Many Institute, and the Board of Directors of Congregation B’nai Jeshurun.

Melissa Marsh, Assoc. AIA, CEO, PLASTARC, is part researcher and part innovator. Leveraging a background in social science with a Master of Architecture at MIT, Melissa defined an early career building cross-disciplinary consulting practices within a number of leading architectural firms. Interested in further exploring the intersection of design and human factors research, Melissa started her own interdisciplinary consultancy firm. PLASTARC, a portmanteau of plastic and architecture, employs social research, design metrics and real estate strategy to create a more flexible and engaging built world. Melissa leads a diverse team - from sociologists to data visualizers -dedicated to shifting the metrics associated with space from square feet and inches to occupant satisfaction and performance. An active contributor to many professional communities, Melissa curates the AIANY Transforming Architectural Practice series which promotes the advancement of the business of architecture through greater dialogue with other disciplines, including technology, business strategy, marketing, and law.

Moderator: 
Tomas Rossant, AIA, 2015 AIANY President; Founding Design Partner, Ennead Architects

This event was preceded by a think tank roundtable discussion with thought leaders deeply involved with collaborative initiatives.
results.name: Edge Collaborations: Creative Partnerships with Social Science

results.description:
Welcome to ORLCAPEX NYC's August 2015 meetup! This meetup will consist of 4 lightning talks that will be around 20 minutes each. And yes, we'll have a countdown timer this time! Here's a look at the agenda:

Marc Sewtz - Configuring PDF printing with APEX 5.0 and ORDS: This session will show you how to configure PDF printing using APEX 5.0 and ORDS and how this compares to using BI Publisher or Apache FOP. We’ll look at printing Interactive Reports and Classic Reports, as well as producing PDFs using the APEX print APIs and attaching generated PDF reports to emails send from within your APEX application.

Tim Chambers - The inner workings of our new APEX 5 JS widgets: APEX 5 and Universal Theme have considerable Javascript dedicated to improving the UX of your apps. This presentation will cover some of this front-end logic from a technical standpoint, to elucidate the kinds of calculations that occur on page load and on page runtime.

Patrick Maniraho - Advanced Data Loading Features: Oracle Application Express has had a "data loading" feature since version 4.1. Subsequent releases have added features to improve the data loading experience and performance. Some of these improvements include column name aliases (which can be used to overcome the 45 columns limit), the ability to map more than one spreadsheet column into one table column, advanced transformation rules, the ability to skip some steps (useful for larger set of records), better management of concurrency, and improved error handling. In this session, we will walk through some examples to highlight these advanced features and tricks that can be used to improve the usability and performance of data loading.

Dan McGhan - Relational to JSON in Oracle Database: There’s no shortage of options when it comes generating JSON from relational data in Oracle Database. In this session I’ll introduce you to several options, from lower level PL/SQL based solutions like PL/JSON and APEX_JSON to higher level solutions that do more than just generate and parse JSON like Oracle REST Data Services and Node.js with the Oracle Database driver.


Note: You must RSVP for this event and seats are limited. Please RSVP with your full name and bring matching ID for security. Please do not RSVP if you are unsure that you will be able to attend. If you do RSVP and are no longer able to attend please change your status so that someone on the waiting list may take your place.

results.description:
Arduino Essentials  is designed to take you beyond  the basics and get you ready to start working on your own  Arduino project.   This six week course will equip tech-friendly beginners with the confidence and skills to use the Arduino platform in multiple future projects.

This is a hands-on course which is designed around a sample project that you build and take home with you at the end of the six weeks.  Each session will focus on a different essential a skill and help you overcome several ‘hurdles’  that have been observed to discourage  those who attempt to solve problems using Arduino. 

Cost: $225 for the full six week course

***Prepayment is required for this course.  One you respond yes on meetup we will reach out to you with payment options.



Digital I/O

• Switches and pull-up resistors

• Driving LED’s

• Power considerations

Analog I/O

• What is an ADC

• PWM

Program Flow Control

• FOR

• IF

• SWITCH CASE

• DELAY

Serial Communication

• Using the Serial Monitor

Interface and Drivers

• Bipolar Transistors and MOSFETs

• Driver chips (ULN2003, ULN2804, LB1205)

• Stepper shields

• H Bridge shields

results.description:
Updated March 8th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. Our main location is Riverside Park, with Morningside as a backup.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

+++

OTHER SEASONS...

WINTER (Nov - Feb)

During the colder months we generally play two times a week depending on weather. Our main location is Riverside Park with Morningside as a backup.

There are two days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
- Sundays at 1pm, Riverside Park (108th and West End - Big Soccer Field)
*Tuesdays/Thursdays at 6pm games don't last long due to decreasing sunlight.

FALL (Sep - Oct)

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 4pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Tuesdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)
- Thursdays at 5:30pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End)

Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play. 
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup? 
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be? 
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like? 
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything? 
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome? 
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect? 
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions? 
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
Graybar Toastmasters is open to all who wish to improve their public speaking and leadership skills. In addition, this is a great way to network with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals.

Founded in 1954, we are one of the oldest Toastmasters clubs in New York City. We are a friendly club with members dedicated to helping each other become better speakers.

We meet from 6:15pm to 8:15pm on the 1st and 3rd Thursdays of each month in the same location. 

Our meetings are structured to allow everbody participate, practice and learn.

In our meetings the members of the club take different roles that allow them to practice and improve their public speaking and leadership skills by completing different projects.

The different roles include giving prepared presentations, chairing the meeting, improvising a short speech, telling a joke, giving feedback to speakers, evaluating the whole meeting, among others, all in a very friendly and supportive environment.

People who RSVP this meetup attend as guests. They introduce themselves at the beginning of the meeting and give feedback at the end, and some of them may participate in an improv exercise, this is an opportunity for you to check out the club coming to one or a couple of meetings, and decide if you want to join as an active member. 

To learn more about Toastmasters International please visit http://www.toastmasters.org/

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: 28 East 35th Street, between Park and Madison in New York City. To enter, please press buzzer #2 outside the red door for the Gallery/Lounge on the 1st Floor. PLEASE attend the meeting only if you RSVP since the space available is limited.
results.name: Graybar Toastmaster meeting!

group.name: Graybar Toastmasters - Become a skilled speaker!

results.description:
Would you like to -

• Become a more confident public speaker?

•Feel more at-ease during business meetings and social occasions?

•Make new friends, in a supportive and encouraging environment?

The friendly people at Pride Toastmasters would love to help you improve your public speaking skills, as you boost your leadership and self confidence skills! We focus on making our guests very welcome. We meet every Thursday from 6:15 p.m. until 7:25 at the LGBT Center, 208 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011. If you arrive early, expect to be warmly greeted and given an overview of what to expect during the fun, informative and engaging meeting! 

By the way, there’s nothing for you to prepare in advance of our meeting, no fee to pay as our guest and no pressure to join.  Please do visit and sample this exciting option for personal and professional growth!

An average of 20 members and guests attend each Pride Toastmasters meeting. Since most aren't members of Meetup, the attendance figures shown here are always much lower.

Please visit our web site at http://www.PrideToastmasters.com
results.how_to_find_us: For Room Assignment Please Check the Room Assignment List in the Lobby

results.description:
Better than the gym Thursdays!

[masked], [masked] are the exact GPS Coordinates for the trail head.  The lower lot is technically right across the street from 64 Skyline Drive address.

Fast night hike.  6 ish miles (been known to reach 7.33 ;-), with about a 900 ft elevation gain

We will meet at the LOWER lot of skyline drive in Oakland at 6:15pm on Thursday evening. This will be approximately a 2 - 3 hour hike.

We will take the blue trail to Ramapo Lake then decide if we take the white trail that leads us to some great views of the sunset and NYC.  We can walk through the Van Slyke Castle. http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/">http://theoaklandjournal.com/oaklandnj/hike-into-history/</a> and decide our descent and length of the hike from here.  Most likely we'll take the white to yellow and back to blue and out. This route will change from week to week depending on group so please have a map or gps.

http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/maps/NYNJTC_NJParkMaps-RamapoMtn_2015-85x11.pdf"></a>" class="linkified">http://www.state.nj.us/dep/parksandforests/parks/maps/NYNJTC_NJParkMaps-RamapoMtn_2015-85x11.pdf;

Bring headlamps, maps and water. Have fun!

FYI...Very good information about ticks available from the website link below. Helps to take away some of the mystery and scare tactics.

http://www.tickencounter.org

--------------------------------------------------------------

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. 

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear. 

The Hudson Valley Hikers Club does not provide liability insurance for the protection of individuals who may participate in any of the events planned by the Organizer or Assistant Organizers. 

This release extends and applies to, and also covers and includes, all unknown, unforeseen, unanticipated and unsuspected injuries, damages, loss and liability. 

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. By signing up for this group or event you understand that you are attending all events AT YOUR OWN RISK. Organizers and Assistant Organizers of this group are just that, we organize the events and hike together as friends. There are no leaders on these hikes, you are your own leader- This is YOUR hike.
results.name: Skyline Drive *Sunset Hike* (NJ)

results.description:
Pre-Dive Orientation and Academic Review

This is a REQUIRED session for anyone planning on doing the certification dives this weekend.

• We will review your SDI Academics. 

• Equipment Requirements

• Dive Planning

Get here extra early to pick up any required or additional equipment you might need for the dives. You should review the equipment checklist.

Finally! Certification Dives are just a few days away.

Before getting certified every diver must come in and review their completed academics with the instructor.

Bring your:

• Completed Final exam

• Skills Checklist

•  Basic OW planner (print from website)

• Introduction to Dive Computers


Using Dive Computers

To help familiarize you with how Underwater Dive Computers work, use the following links: Introduction to Dive Computers. (There is a nominal fee) Using an Underwater computer is one of the safest ways to dive today. Computers are relatively inexpensive and very reliable. Putting the tools you need to complete a safe and fun dive right in your hand. Enroll and complete online course,  when finished printout and bring us the results/certificate. Introduction to Dive Computers

</a>

<a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/pdfs/whybuymyown.pdf">Why Buy My Own Equipment? Diving more than most other sports requires reliable equipment and instruction on its proper use. Don’t listen to an inexperienced expert or be fooled by the online hype, you get the best gear right here, from the people you can trust.

EQUIPMENT: You are responsible for having all the gear you need to dive this weekend. Arrange equipment rentals with the shop.and pick up any rental equipment you will need. You will be wearing a thicker wetsuit, which you must try on to ensure proper fit. Purchasing Neoprene gloves is also highly recommended. Scuba Gear required for Certification Dives.

Additionally you will need

SDI Logbook

Planning Slate

Equipment requirements for Certification Dives

Wetsuit (6mm or 7mm)

Hood

Weights and weight belt

BCD (Buoyancy Compensator Device)

Regulator

Dive Computer 

SCUBA Cylinder

You should reserve your equipment in advance and pick it up before the weekend. You are responsible for transporting all the equipment needed to complete your certification dives.

Call us with any questions. [masked]

Print out a few copies of the dive planner to bring with you tonight. Basic OW planner
results.how_to_find_us: 2nd floor

results.description:
Join us for a panel discussion on various forms of financing and funding for early-stage green companies.

Learn while you network with other green business enthusiasts and founders.


RSVP for a free ticket... and launch your cleantech startup or green business with help from experts.

results.description:
Hi Folks,

At our last meeting many attendees expressed interest in trading, but were at a loss as to how to embark on the journey. We'll tackle that at the upcoming meeting. For those that are already trading, we'll also talk about having a process and enhancing what you're doing.

A description of the agenda follows this note.


Hope you can make it.

Best,

*Mitch FIrestone

Organizer

=======================

Getting Started – Trading is a progression:

First, you need to determine the type of trader you wish/need to be based on your lifestyle, temperament, interest in trading, the time you wish to devote to it, and risk capital you have. The main styles of trading are position trading (long-term positions, sometimes referred to as buy-and-hold), long-term swing positions (a few weeks to months), shorter-term swing positions (1+ days to a few days or a couple weeks), intraday (a.k.a. Day-trading where you open & close a position within the same trading day), and scalping (a few minutes to a few seconds. These are often trades that take on large position-size in order to grab profits with a small move in price in a very short time).

Next you need to adopt & start learning some set of core trading principles – e.g.,


• momentum methodologies based on trend analysis and price action using chart patterns or specific candlestick formations. This entails getting into a trade where there is a well defined, strong directional price movement. You open a position based on certain metrics. This is akin to jumping into the back of a pickup truck as it's going by you, or when it slows or pauses a bit & then continues in the same direction.

• retracement methodologies, again based on trend analysis and price action using chart patterns or specific candlestick formations. Here you identify the overarching trend or local price movement, then wait for price to reverse in order to return (correct or retrace) to a particular price level where it will then be expected to reverse and start heading back in its original direction. This predominant move is referred as the impulse. The reversal is into the zone is the correction. This is akin to watching a car go by & waiting for it to turn around & pick you up & then reverse in the original direction it was traveling. The popular waiting to “buy the dip” is the poster child for a retracement strategy.

• an intelligent combination of indicators and oscillators (moving averages, RSI, CCI, stochastics, MACD, etc.)

Once you've mastered core trading principles and a general methodology, you then need to adopt and/or develop a strategy, e.g., “I will buy stocks to hold for a few days that are in a daily uptrend in the strongest two industrial sectors, and will use a lower timeframe to enter this broad trend using one of the three methods above (momentum, retracement or indicators/oscillators).

Following from the strategy you then need to determine the specific steps, tools and analysis you are going to do to screen for opportunities and then establish and qualify set-ups. These are your tactics.

Given our discussions at the July 14 meet-up and how many people are hunting for how to take the first steps in exploring trading we will step people through everything above, and tell you about what we do here in the trade room with our personal trading as well as novice and experienced traders we work with. This will give you a starting point in determining a logical route to exploring the world of trading.

results.description:
Everything you ever wanted to know about DSLR photography, but were too afraid to ask :)

This class will be great for those who:
- are absolute DSLR beginners
- just bought their first DSLR, or are thinking of buying one
- used to know DSLR, but need a refresher course  
- own a DSLR but always shoot in automatic mode

How long is the class?
This is a 2 hour class. It will run from 6:30-8:30. Please arrive 10-15 mins early to check in. 


Description
This class will focus on Digital SLR but most of the concepts will also apply to Film SLR photographers as well. It is not meant for people who have a point and shoot camera. In this class you'll learn everything from the very beginning. This is a hands-on class. After discussing each topic, we'll assist you with finding the specific setting on your own camera when applicable,

What will you learn about?
What is a DSLR
What's inside an SLR
Focal length
Types of Lenses
Shutter Speed
Aperture
ISO
White Balance
Exposure
Metering
Shooting Modes
Depth of Field Tips on how to take great photos
Drive Speed (frames per second) 
Camera Raw / Photoshop 
HDR Photography 
Light painting 
Light Meters 
Filters
Megapixels

Will there be time for Q&A after the class?
Yes!

Arriving at the class
This event is located at: 
University Settlement - Houston Street Center
273 Bowery New York, NY 10007
Phone: (212)[masked]
Make make sure you check in with the University Settlement front desk on the left down the stairs. The staff will direct you to the room. The class is taking place in classroom 3 on the 2nd floor. 

Price: $30 
You can pay in cash when you arrive. 
I also accept PayPal, please send me a message if you would like to know what email to send the payment to.

A bit on my experience:
I've been shooting DSLR since the summer of 2009. Since then I've taken various photography courses from the basics to advanced photo composition, portraiture, studio lighting, TTL flash and digital image post-processing. I started a small race photography company (CosmicPix.com) and have done a little bit of wedding photography as well.


A brief note about RSVPs, please please please only RSVP if you're sure you can make it. I need accurate numbers for the room reservation. And as always if you know right off the bat that you can't make it, no need to let us know. Only RSVP NO where you were previously a YES. 

Light snacks and refreshments will be available

If you need to reach me (Henry), feel free to call/text me at (646)[masked]

results.description: Whether you are pregnant or a mom, there is no question that you are more likely to stick with an exercise routine if it is enjoyable. Hoopnotica hoopdancing, recommended by FitPregnancy magazine as a fresh prenatal fitness trend, is a total body workout that will keep you smiling while you tone your muscles, strengthen your core, and obtain a fabulous cardiovascular workout. No prior dance experience is necessary and even if you are completely new to hula hooping, as soon as you give it a whirl, you will be hooked! The hour-long class will provide a nice change of pace for those pregnant women who are bored and unmotivated by the typical prenatal workouts. We will practice hooping on the waist, hips, chest, shoulders and legs, and will do various moves incorporating hooping on and off the body. Although non-pregnant hoopers will also be in attendance, modifications for all pregnant hoopers will be taught as necessary.  Please let me know if you'll need to rent a hoop for $3. Class costs $20 (cash only) or a package of 10 is $180 (get one class free!). (In the event of rain, we'll likely be under the covered area on the East River Promenade (East River near 82nd Street) but be sure to check in with me before heading over.) You can reach me at 914.645.5031.

results.description:
Starred Review. Mosley (Known to Evil) plays out an intriguing premise in his powerful latest: a man is given a second shot at life, but at the price of a hastened death. Ptolemy Grey is a 91-year-old man, suffering from dementia and living as a recluse in his Los Angeles apartment. With one foot in the past and the other in the grave, Ptolemy begins to open up when Robyn Small, a 17-year-old family friend, appears and helps clean up his apartment and straighten out his life. A reinvigorated Ptolemy volunteers for an experimental medical program that will restore his mind, but at hazardous cost: he won't live to see 92. With the clock ticking, Ptolemy uses his rejuvenated mental abilities to delve into the mystery of the recent drive-by shooting death of his great-nephew, Reggie, and to render justice the only way he knows how, goaded and guided by the memory of his murdered childhood mentor, Coydog McCann. Though the details of the experimental procedure are less than convincing, Mosley's depiction of the indignities of old age is heartbreaking, and Ptolemy's grace and decency make for a wonderful character and a moving novel. (Nov.) (c)
Copyright © Reed Business Information, a division of Reed Elsevier Inc. All rights reserved

http://articles.latimes.com/2010/nov/18/entertainment/la-et-rutten-20101118

This week we will raise a glass and show our support for fellow cyclist Dave. Dave is in critical condition with severe head trauma at Kings County Hospital after a serious bicycle accident on Wednesday July 22nd, 2015.


Gold Sprints and a Silent Auction and Raffle are being organized by Cannonball Couriers over at East River Bar. Online donations payable to gofundme.com/DPRfund

We will do our best to stick together but please have someone’s number to call if you ride ahead and lose the group. There are a few stretches where everyone will be invited to pedal at their preferred pace and mass up points will be called out along the route…so grab your bike and bring your friends!


WHEN: Meet up at 6:30 pm, Wheels down at 7:00 pm!

MEET-UP: USS Maine National Monument, Columbus Circle

1849 Broadway, NY, NY 10023

http://goo.gl/maps/qUIEL

END SPOT: East River Bar, 97 South 6th Street, Brooklyn, New York 11211

http://eastriverbar.com/


ROUTE: http://tinyurl.com/nrv8tfs

</a>
DISTANCE: <7 Miles (one way)

LINK TO EVENT: https://www.facebook.com/events/491071887727300/


Ever endeavoring to turn social cyclists into cycling commuters.
The goals are to ride bikes and hang out with friends that love riding bikes.

Feel free to contact us with any questions/concerns.
[masked]

CAUTION: If you like to ride ahead of the lead, please be sure to test the route for your own safety and for the safety of anyone that doesn't know the route and follows you. Feel free to ride ahead on bridges as we always mass up on the other side.

WHAT YOU NEED:

NYC Department of Transportation Bicycle Laws, Rules & Regulations require: White headlight and red taillight must be used from dusk to dawn, bell or other audible signal (not whistle), working brakes, and reflective tires and/or other reflective devices.

Social Cycling NYC strongly recommends that every cyclist: Follows NYC DOT rules, EXPECTS all cyclists to accept personal responsibility for their own actions (or lack thereof), and recommends cyclists bring/use bikes, helmets, locks, IDs, money for food and drinks, and cycling friends!

HOW: WE ride AS traffic and NOT AGAINST it. We stop at red lights, yield the right of way and let cars pass as best we can. We don't block intersections. We are nice to both our fellow riders and the other traffic on the road. LISTEN TO the volunteers helping to lead the ride. They are some nice people and have your best interests in mind. If you have any questions about the rules, please check here: <a href="http://www.nyc.gov/html/look/html/cyclist/cyclist_safety_text.shtml#sec6">http://www.nyc.gov/html/look/html/cyclist/cyclist_safety_text.shtml#sec6

REMINDER: The goal is to create a safe environment for all riders, but we cannot control, nor do we desire to, every rider's behavior. We promote personal responsibility and all riders are responsible for themselves. If you choose to ride with us, then you accept the risks inherent in riding a bicycle with a large group of other people riding bicycles.

Social Cycling New York City is modeled after Social Cycling Austin.https://www.facebook.com/socialcyclingaustin/info

Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days
Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

If you are a total beginner to indoor climbing (never climbed or belayed before), you will need to take a class. Please book "Climbing 101: TopRope Basics" at 6:30 pm on Tuesday by entering promo code HALF-PRICE-CARD or call[masked] & mention NYC Active meetup to get 50% off. This class will teach you how to tie the rope and belay your climbing partner. Gear rental is included in the class. You can still do boulder without taking the class or being belay certified though.

If you are new to The Cliffs at LIC but have been belayed certified in other gym, you can take a test & it will only take few minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please feel free to see me & we can practice together.

More info: http://lic.thecliffsclimbing.com/
results.name: Thursday Rock Climbing at The Cliffs LIC

results.description:
This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

 

==> Learning & Practice RESOURCES

Various materials http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/thread/3199165/0#[masked]

KANJI http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1175397
KATAKANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198386
HIRAGANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198387

Please click over DISCUSSIONS ->Message Board, then select your favorite topic. Have a lot of FUN learning about Nihon & Nihongo! http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me, with the pile of Japanese dictionaries at one of the tables in the Atrium, or one of the other groups speaking in and about Japanese.

results.description:
A “prompt” is a writing exercise with a specific theme and a time limit. These small exercises get writers to move away from their comfort zone and try a new genre, voice or character. Inspiration can be drawn from unlikely places and time limits lead to creativity.

JCW members provide the writing prompts on a rotating basis. These prompts can be anything the scheduled writer decides. The only rule is the group just has 10 minutes to write it!

results.name: WRITING PROMPTS w/ Jim

Join us for an evening of crafting and pint sipping at Whole Foods in Brooklyn on 3rd Avenue and 3rd Street in Gowanus. We will be sitting in the Roof bar, stairs and elevator at the front entrance of the store. Food and beer available for purchase as well as getting anything tasty from the market below. Bring a crafting project and your thirst, this tap and wine list is darn good.

Directions: Take the F/G to the 4th & 9th Street stop and walk 5 blocks north and one avenue east to 3rd Ave and 3rd Street or take the R to the Union Street stop and walk four blocks south and one avenue east.

Hope to see you there!

results.description:
A Hypnotic & Vortex Healing® Journey

1st Thursday of each month (date may vary)

6:30 – 8:30 PM (ending time may vary)

$35-regular price/

</a><a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hypnotic-vortex-healing-guided-meditation-tickets-17541552255">$25-early bird (available until 3 days before event)


Please join us this evening to experience a fusion of 2 powerful  modalities -

•  Guided Meditation & Hypnosis

•  And VortexHealing®: Divine Energy Therapy

and how they can help you, and enjoy how wonderfully and synergistically they work together.

Do You Want to Learn More About Hypnosis, Energywork, Vortex Healing® or Spirituality?

Do You Have Something that is Troubling You, You Want Something Different from the Way Your Life is Going Right Now?

Are you stuck, uncertain, confused, frustrated or something else? You’re not sure if it’s emotional, energetic, mental or spiritual.


Come join Joel & Simon, and

• Let go of old thoughts, habits and beliefs

• Release blocked karma and energy

• Open gateways of mind and spirit

• Remove limitations

• Set new, more powerful intentions

• Heal old emotional issues

and begin to achieve your most heartfelt desires.

First timers, Experienced Journeyers, Come, Participate, Explore & Transform!

Give yourself this gift of healing and change


Experience Simon & Joel working together:

Joel will guide you into trance. Relaxing your mind and body, connecting you to your unconscious. Let his positive suggestions help you go deeper in trance, feel yourself become more receptive to Simon’s healing energies, divine consciousness and support healthy, ecological, appropriate change. As your trance deepens, imagine habits changing, limiting beliefs dissolving, new insights and subtle, rich, wonderful transformations occurring.

Simon will channel the VortexHealing® energies and divine essences. He will channel from the deepest levels of divine consciousness, releasing and awakening the deepest levels of emotional blocks and negative conditioning from your system. Imagine a vast set of divine frequencies and energies so powerful that there is no limit to where they can heal and transform. VortexHealing® creates powerful healing acceleration, releases karmic blocks, cleanses chakras, powerfully shifts your reality to higher divine expressions while connecting to your angels, guides and deities.

As Joel & Simon, continue to work together, envision Guided Meditation and Vortex Healing® complimenting each other. Notice the words take on more power, the energy flowing more strongly deeply. And find yourself opening more to your unconscious, Divine Consciousness and Spiritual awakening.

Imagine releasing the mental and energetic blocks that disconnect you from yourself and from the divine in times of stress and crisis.

Imagine feeling the energies inspire the words, and the words guide your energies.

Imagine opening your awareness to encompass the dance between these elements each time going deeper, and deeper, places you weren’t even aware of, helping you create more change, more release.


Imagine feeling new hope, new ideas re-energized.

What to Expect: We create a safe and comfortable space, and take the time to answer any questions you might have. Typically, there are 2-3 rounds of guided meditation and Vortex Healing® combined. In each round, Simon and Joel work together. Joel guides the meditation with words, creating trance. And Simon channels the Vortex Healing® energies.

Each round, words, energies and trance will blend together, taking deeper into mind, body, energy and soul to create more profound effects. Who is this class for? This class is for anyone who is curious about experiencing hypnosis, energy work and wants to make change in their life. What’s required for this class? Just bring yourself, an openness to new experience and the possibility of change.

=================================

For more go here or try the links below to answer more questions:

Joel Elfman’s website and Hypnosis & NLP FAQs

Simon Deacon’s website and more info about Vortex Healing

=============================

$35-regular price/

</a><a href="https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hypnotic-vortex-healing-guided-meditation-tickets-17541552255">$25-early bird (available until 3 days before event)

=============================================================

Come share this journey, and experience these 2 amazing modalities, hypnosis and Vortex Healing blending together to help your unique goals and needs.

We look forward to seeing you. Joel & Simon

------------------------------------------

Joel Elfman is Hypnotist, NLP trainer and bodyworker with over 15 years of experience. He helps transform old issues such as stress reduction, social anxiety/confidence and weight loss. Change and create new habits and beliefs for life.

For more about Joel visit his website, www.joelelfman.com

results.description:
We're excited to present NYC's 1st Annual Timmy Awards to recognize the best places for technology professionals to work. The "Timmys" are hosted by Tech in Motion, a national events organization for tech enthusiasts created by Jobspring Partners & Workbridge Associates. 

The Timmy Awards winners and nominees will be recognized at a gala event this summer on Thursday, August 6th, 2015 at NYU's Rosenthal Pavilion. The evening will begin with cocktails, hor d'oeuvres, music and product demos from past Tech in Motion "Audience Favorites." Tech in Motion Audience Favorites to be announced soon. 

The Finalists for New York City’s Best Tech Startup:


• Biolite

• Body Labs

• Casper

• Karma

• Knewton

• Pager

• Plated

• Reserve

• Smart Vision Labs

• TodayTix

The Finalists for New York City’s Best Tech Manager:

• Bill Manguson – Co-Founder & CTO, Appboy

• Hadas Nahon – Tech Lead, BDB Payroll

• Omri Block – COO, Bounce Exchange

• Nathalie du Preez – Co-Founder & CEO, Bunchcut

• Gabriel Flateman – Co-Founder & CTO, Casper

• Ryan Caloras – Tech Lead, Gilt

• Robb Chen-Ware – Senior Product Manager, HappyFunCorp

• Leonard Landsdorf – VP Applications Development & Head of the IQ Lab, S&P Capital IQ

• Jack Cole – Director of Design, Motivate Design

• Laura Stewart – Senior Project Manager, Infusion

The Finalists for New York City’s Best Technology Work Culture:

• Audible

• Bitly

• Gilt

• Jet.com

• LinkedIn

• MongoDB

• Pandora Radio

• Rackspace

• Take the Interview

• Timehop

• Venmo

 


Our Demo Companies:

• Smart Vision Labs

• ThinkEco


• Total Cinema 360

Visit Tech in Motion to learn more about The Timmy Awards! 


--


As always we would like to thank our sponsors Workbridge Associates, Jobspring Partners, IBM and Sharingbox for sponsoring this month’s event. 

Learn more about our headline sponsors: 

IBM:

IBM is a globally integrated technology and consulting company headquartered in Armonk, New York. With operations in more than 170 countries, IBM attracts and retains some of the world's most talented people to help solve problems and provide an edge for businesses, governments and non-profits.
Innovation is at the core of IBM's strategy. The company develops and sells software and systems hardware and a broad range of infrastructure, cloud and consulting services. Today, IBM is focused on four growth initiatives - business analytics, cloud computing, growth markets and Smarter Planet. IBMers are working with customers around the world to apply the company's business consulting, technology and R&D expertise to build systems that enable dynamic and efficient organizations, better transportation, safer food, cleaner water and healthier populations. 

Sharingbox: A Must have Marketing tool

The sharingbox was custom designed for the smoothest user experience possible. Sleek, compact and 100% customizable, it blends into any display. Installed anywhere and in no time at all, one electrical outlet is all it needs to light up your event.

Partybox: You are planning a wedding, a birthday party or a cocktail? You are looking for that perfect animation that will make your night unforgettable? An entirely customizable, compact and sleek photobooth, the sharingbox holds up to 10 people on each photo! Its tactile and intuitive interface entertains and rekindles the craziness hidden within your guests. It captures their most genuine smiles, their most natural poses and sets them in stone within seconds with instant printing.


Interested in sponsoring a Tech in Motion event? Click Here!

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).


We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at some point. If you'd like to run additional miles, you are certainly more than welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. Depending on the turnout we sometimes break off into little groups of two or three people, each of which may go at slightly different paces and/or distances. Regardless, if you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

For those who wish to stick around after the run, we may get together at (insert favorite Ridgewood hot spot here) to relax, catch up, and share some laughs. When we do this, we usually get to the restaurant between 7:30 and 7:45. If anyone cares to join us that didn't come to the run, you are certainly welcome.

We will run rain or shine, hot or cold. If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time as we'll only wait a couple of minutes past 6:30 PM to get rolling. If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me. Looking forward to seeing you on Thursday.
results.name: 4 Mile Run in Ridgewood (Wild Duck Pond)

results.description:
This is a Not-for-Profit Planning event for Lupus Friends and Family Foundation Inc. (www.LupusFriendsAndFamily.org). We are focused on spreading love, support and resources to patients suffering from Lupus. We are planning our very first event and need all the help we can get to make it a huge success. 

Volunteers who have skills in event planning, fundraising, online auctions, marketing, promotions, volunteer recruitment, social media, blogging, have media and celebrity connections, knows someone with lupus, and/or just want to help out should attend this event. 

We will meet in Union Square to discuss what needs to be done to make our first patient-to-patient event a huge success. Please invite your skilled friends to sign up, too. I will provide snacks. 

If you want to help out but cannot attend this event, please contact me directly at [masked]. 

I look forward to seeing you. 

Charlotta
results.name: Not-for-profit lupus patient Event Planning

results.description:
After learning the machine basics and making a tote, let's continue with some new fresh projects. Leggings may seem a bit daunting, but with the right guidance, pattern and techniques they are actually pretty easy.

What we learn:
Go over how to use the machine
How to sew with stretch fabric
How to use stretch stitches
How to finish a garment
Hem a pair of pants
Sew an elastic waistband
Use a pattern for sewing Garments
Take measurements 

What we need:
1.25 Yards of fun Spandex fabric- you can find this at Spandex House, Spandex World or any of those Spandex stores on 38th St (NYC) between 7th and 8th Ave.
I will provide the patterns, and elastic for waistband. Feel free to invite other creative and nice friends to the group and classes.
Please RSVP and let me know you are coming- so I can send the address and phone number to let you in.

$60/class- you must buy fabric, i will provide elastic.
results.name: DUMBO SEWING-Freshen Up Sewing Skills and make Funky Leggings/Yoga Pants, BYOB

DANCING UNDER THE STARS TO THE FDR Dance BAND @ SAXON WOODS!!!

Saxon Woods Grill continues to be the place to go on Thursday nights for dancing and great food from Mid-May to past Labor Day.  On Thursday Nights, Saxon Woods Grill has their famous BBQ Buffet and live music featuring some of the hottest local bands.  Join your hostess STACY for their great BBQ Buffet and dancing under the stars on their outdoor patio to the music .  Cost for the Buffet and Band is $20 or if you prefer just pay a $10 Cover Charge for the Band alone. The BBQ Buffet start at 6PM and ends @ 10PM and the band plays from 7:30-11PM.  Come as early as possible to get a good parking space.

results.description:
We will have a short talk.  This will be followed by one or two meditation sessions and a bit more discussion focused on people's experience and questions arising from that experience?

Currently we are usually working with an innovative form of the Buddha's Anapanasati Sutta, which guides one through the process from sitting down and paying attention to the breath through full liberation. It is a profound and ancient teaching, and like many of the Buddha's teachings, speaks to us in remarkably modern language.

Please bring a cushion  or meditation bench for sitting on the floor if you have one.  Please mention in your rsvp whether you use a chair or cushion.  Location may shift to a larger venue as group expands.

There is no fee for this group.  Members are encouraged to make a freewill donation no matter how small or large.  No one should feel they cannot come for financial reasons. Sharing the teaching and its benefits is the priority.  All with sincere interest are welcome.  Both beginners and old time meditators have reported great value in the mediations and discussions.

 

Parking is available at the library and around the corner at the shopping center
results.name: Meditatively exploring our experience of body and mind

results.description:
Given the likely size of the group this Thursday, having a big table reserved will be essential, and it was necessary to change the venue to The Malt House on 206 Thompson St (about a block from Amity Hall). Apologies for the late change! 

***

Big things are happening in EA - this meetup is scheduled for the week after the first EA Global conference (which will be live-streamed online) and the release of Will MacAskill's Doing Good Better.

Let's talk about those things, the future of the movement, the uncertainties around the effects of deworming on education, and all other things EA.

For newcomers, read on:


If you aren't already familiar with the wider EA movement, I'm glad to have reached your eyeballs! Effective altruism is about recognizing the importance of using our lives to do the most good we can and looking for ways to help others that are high-impact and well-supported by evidence. This approach may sound obvious, but careful consideration of the impact of different strategies for doing good can lead to some surprising, and even controversial, conclusions. Ethical philosophy, career strategizing, economics, and persuasion methods play important roles in these considerations, so EA attracts smart people and provides intellectually invigorating topics of discussion.

A great way to start learning about our perspective is to watch Peter Singer's TED talk:
http://www.ted.com/talks/peter_singer_the_why_and_how_of_effective_altruism?language=en

If it piques your interest, have a look through the introductory links on the Effective Altruism Forum:
http://effective-altruism.com/ea/6x/introduction_to_effective_altruism/

...and let us know what you think!

Feel free to send me a message if you'd like to know more. Hope to see you there!

-Chris
results.name: Effective Altruism hangout and discussion

1st Thursday of each month (date may vary)

</a>

Please join us this evening to experience a fusion of 2 powerful  modalities -

•  Guided Meditation & Hypnosis

•  And VortexHealing®: Divine Energy Therapy

and how they can help you, and enjoy how wonderfully and synergistically they work together.

Do You Want to Learn More About Hypnosis, Energywork, Vortex Healing® or Spirituality?

Do You Have Something that is Troubling You, You Want Something Different from the Way Your Life is Going Right Now?

Are you stuck, uncertain, confused, frustrated or something else? You’re not sure if it’s emotional, energetic, mental or spiritual.


Come join Joel & Simon, and

• Let go of old thoughts, habits and beliefs

• Release blocked karma and energy

• Open gateways of mind and spirit

• Remove limitations

• Set new, more powerful intentions

• Heal old emotional issues

and begin to achieve your most heartfelt desires.

First timers, Experienced Journeyers, Come, Participate, Explore & Transform!

Give yourself this gift of healing and change


Experience Simon & Joel working together:

Joel will guide you into trance. Relaxing your mind and body, connecting you to your unconscious. Let his positive suggestions help you go deeper in trance, feel yourself become more receptive to Simon’s healing energies, divine consciousness and support healthy, ecological, appropriate change. As your trance deepens, imagine habits changing, limiting beliefs dissolving, new insights and subtle, rich, wonderful transformations occurring.

Simon will channel the VortexHealing® energies and divine essences. He will channel from the deepest levels of divine consciousness, releasing and awakening the deepest levels of emotional blocks and negative conditioning from your system. Imagine a vast set of divine frequencies and energies so powerful that there is no limit to where they can heal and transform. VortexHealing® creates powerful healing acceleration, releases karmic blocks, cleanses chakras, powerfully shifts your reality to higher divine expressions while connecting to your angels, guides and deities.

As Joel & Simon, continue to work together, envision Guided Meditation and Vortex Healing® complimenting each other. Notice the words take on more power, the energy flowing more strongly deeply. And find yourself opening more to your unconscious, Divine Consciousness and Spiritual awakening.

Imagine releasing the mental and energetic blocks that disconnect you from yourself and from the divine in times of stress and crisis.

Imagine feeling the energies inspire the words, and the words guide your energies.

Imagine opening your awareness to encompass the dance between these elements each time going deeper, and deeper, places you weren’t even aware of, helping you create more change, more release.


Imagine feeling new hope, new ideas re-energized.

What to Expect: We create a safe and comfortable space, and take the time to answer any questions you might have. Typically, there are 2-3 rounds of guided meditation and Vortex Healing® combined. In each round, Simon and Joel work together. Joel guides the meditation with words, creating trance. And Simon channels the Vortex Healing® energies.

Each round, words, energies and trance will blend together, taking deeper into mind, body, energy and soul to create more profound effects. Who is this class for? This class is for anyone who is curious about experiencing hypnosis, energy work and wants to make change in their life. What’s required for this class? Just bring yourself, an openness to new experience and the possibility of change.
