results.description:
Everything you ever wanted to know about DSLR photography, but were too afraid to ask :)

This class will be great for those who: 
- are absolute DSLR beginners 
- just bought their first DSLR, or are thinking of buying one 
- used to know DSLR, but need a refresher course  
- own a DSLR but always shoot in automatic mode 

How long is the class? 
This is a 2 hour session held in a classroom. It will run from 6:30-8:30. **Please arrive 10-15 mins early to check in. 

Description 
I (Henry) am the instructor for the course. This class will focus on Digital SLR but most of the concepts will also apply to Film SLR photographers as well. It is not meant for people who have a point and shoot camera. Mirrorless cameras are OK. Those that bring their SLR camera to class will benefit the most, but it is not required that you bring one with you. In this class you'll learn everything from the very beginning. This is a hands-on class. After discussing each topic, we'll assist you with finding the specific setting on your own camera when applicable. In addition, we will take photos in class and learn how to create properly exposed shots by modifying each exposure setting after we go through the *theory* explanation of what each setting does and means. 

What will you learn about? 
What is a DSLR 
What's inside an SLR 
Focal length 
Types of Lenses 
Shutter Speed 
Aperture 
ISO 
White Balance 
Exposure 
Metering 
Shooting Modes 
Depth of Field
Tips on how to take great photos 
Drive Speed (frames per second) 
Camera Raw / Photoshop 
HDR Photography 
Light painting 
Light Meters 
Filters 

Will there be time for Q&A after the class? 
Yes! 

Arriving at the class
This event is located at: 
University Settlement - Houston Street Center
273 Bowery New York, NY 10007
Phone: (212)[masked]
Make make sure you check in with the University Settlement front desk on the left down the stairs. The staff will direct you to the room. The class is taking place in classroom 3 on the 2nd floor.  *Confirm with the receptionist when you arrive*

Price: $30
You can pay in cash when you arrive.
I also accept PayPal, please send me a message if you would like to know what email to send the payment to.

A bit on my experience:
I've been shooting DSLR since the summer of 2009. Since then I've taken various photography courses from the basics to advanced photo composition, portraiture, studio lighting, TTL flash and digital image post-processing. I started a small race photography company (CosmicPix.com) and have done a little bit of wedding photography as well.

A brief note about RSVPs, only RSVP if you're sure you can make it. I need accurate numbers for the room reservation. And as always if you know right off the bat that you can't make it, no need to let us know. Only RSVP NO where you were previously a YES. 

If you need to reach me (Henry), feel free to call/text me at (646)[masked]

results.description:
Join us for a book review of the AMORC book The Mystic Path by Raymund Andrea.

The topic for this week's discussion is Chapter 1: Mystical Knowledge: Its Paramount Value.

You can download the chapter free here!

About the Book

Former Rosicrucian Grand Master Andrea discusses subjects of particular importance to all people traveling on the mystical path. This informative and inspirational work will guide you across the threshold of mystical initiation. The author provides insights into the states of consciousness and experiences you may have as you travel the mystic path. It is filled with the fire and paths of the initiate’s quest. His spiritual, mental, and physical crises are fully described and pondered. Andrea’s deep understanding of the essence of Western mystical and transcendental thought makes this a book you will treasure and refer to often as you advance in your mystical studies. 

Among the many topics addressed are: Meditation, Contemplation, Awakening Consciousness, the Dark Night of the Soul, Mystical Participation, and Mystical Union.


All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - The Mystic Path: Mystical Knowledge

This program delves into the themes of our exhibition."

Morris Adjmi, FAIA, Founder and Principal of Morris Adjmi Architects
Peg Breen, President, The New York Landmarks Conservancy
Kenneth K. Fisher, Member, Cozen O'Connor

Robert Tierney (moderator), Former Chair of the Landmarks Preservation Commission

Reception to follow.

results.description:
100% renewables won't happen by itself

New York City could do that, healthy, sensible, safe, sane and sustainable energy, no fossil fuel or nuclear, and the City Council has passed or introduced bills to get there, with the latest being Resolution #694, recommending that the NRC not relicense Indian Point. To become active on closing I.P. or increasing the renewable energy of NYC or lower the City's greenhouse gases, join us at the NYC Safe Energy Campaign.
Entergy has been sending notices to nearly every Con Ed customer saying they provide 25% of NYC's electricity, which is impossible. At the next meeting, we'll discuss how to respond to that. August 6th, Thursday, 6:30PM, NYU School of Law, Furman Hall, 245 Sullivan Street, btw W 3rd and W 4th Sts., Seminar Room 120.
Since the Climate March, we've been meeting the first and third Thursdays, with pot luck and socializing at 6:30PM and meeting from 7 to 9PM. Check the NYCSEC.org web site for locations.

Call your City Councilmember and ask them to co-sponsor Resolution #694 to Shut Down Indian Point. To find out who your City Councilmember is and to find out if they are one of the 17 (of 49) members who have sponsored it, go to www.nycsec.org or facebook: NYCSEC
results.name: bring NYC 100% renewable energy - no fossil fuel or nuclear

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
New York Tarot Tarotology is a class devoted to the study of the pictorial language of the Tarot. Have you ever wondered "What do the cards mean?" Or, "Why does every book you've looked at say the cards mean something else?" This class will answer both those questions and a lot more. 

The on-going classes, will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles assigned to each card in the Tarot as well as what each title means, Astrology and the Tarot, Qabalah and the Tarot, which includes a small study on the Tree of Life. 

All levels are welcome, even if this is your very first class.

There will be a Meet-Up sign on the table.


If you'd like you will be able to get something light to eat or drink. 

Please bring a sweater just in case they turn the air-conditioning up. They have not done this before but it's good to be prepared, just in case.

This class will be a comprehensive study of the Chariot card in the Major Arcana. I will begin the class promptly at 7:00 PM. Please try to arrive on time because they do close at 9:30 PM and we have a lot to cover. 

I will arrive at 6:00 PM to get us a table. 

Payment can be made in class.

results.description:
Turn up the heat and own your Summer with Russian Martial Arts!

CONQUER THE FEAR of a violent encounter.

INCREASE YOUR STRIKING POWER and learn practical self defense methods that will work ANYTIME, ANYWHERE


Develop a STRONG, FLEXIBLE, MOBILE PHYSIQUE and MENTAL FOCUS that will carry over into every aspect of your life.


Learn all this and much, much more at NJ RMA Self Defense Group, the official Meetup Group of System of Combat NJ.  Start your SUMMER with with Russian Martial Arts, your first class is FREE.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1tm6NW32NdI


Enjoy your first class for free and after that, it is only $10 per class with discounts available for pre-payment. No contract required! Classes are held at 7:00pm on Tuesday and Thursday evenings at the YMHA OF UNION on 501 Green Lane, Union, NJ 07083.

About Us

If you are interested in Systema, Reality Based Self Defense,  Martial Arts, Grappling, Street Defense, or Mobility and Body Awareness, this is the Meetup Group for you.  Men and women, seasoned martial artists and raw beginners alike will benefit from our dynamic classes which are tailored to the level and needs of the students. We focus on providing comprehensive instruction, plenty of personal attention and a relaxed atmosphere where you can train at your own pace and intensity. Individual classes are fast-paced and varied, ranging in subject from striking mechanics, grappling and ground fighting, evasive movement, weapon defense, sparring, and dealing with multiple attackers to women's self defense and street safety.
Copyright © 2013 System of Combat NJ                                   

About Systema

Systema is a combat style based on ancient Slavic fighting methods which were collected and codified by the Russian Soviet special forces.  It is a devastatingly effective and versatile combative program that can easily stand alone, or augment your existing practice.  The overarching focus is on responding to a threat spontaneously with natural, instinctive movement which strengthens and restores the body, clarifies the mind, and provides a framework for healthy, safe, life-long activity 

About the instructor 

Jim has over 25 years of martial arts experience in various styles including Brazilian Jiu-jitsu (BJJ), Silat, Boxing, Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) and Karate.  He is certified to teach Systema by Alex Wilkie (Alex Wilkie's Martial Arts Academy).

Directions

When you arrive, let the front desk know you are there for the martial arts class and they will direct you. (You do not have to be a Y-member to attend this class).  For general inquiries or more information, message organizers Jimi D or Drew here on the Meetup page.  If you need to reach the instructor, Jim, for any reason, call 

<a>[masked]</a>

.- numbers may not show- phone number in words:

-nine-zero-eight-three-zero-three-five-zero-three-one-


Looking forward to training with you!

results.description:
We are finally organizing our own series of wine tastings. But they will be tastings with a twist: each tasting will be in a different NYC neighborhood and will features selections sold by a top wine shop in the 'hood. The first tasting will be held in Kensington, Brooklyn. The cooperating shop will be The Juice Box. Location is my house (in the garden if the weather cooperates). I'll send directions to everybody who RSVPs.

The theme for this tasting will be "Summer Wines from the Mediterranean". Wines to be tasted will include:

Cuvée Des Dames de Verez Rosé 2014 Côtes de Provence 
Cristina Ascheri Langhe Arneis Blanc 2013 Piemonte 
Château Maris Cru La Livinière Les Planels Rouge 2011 Minervois La Livinière Biodynamic
Domaine Le Couroulu Vacqueyras  Rouge 2012 Cuvée Classique 
Côtes du Roussillon Villages (2013) M. Chapoutier Bila-Haut

And a few more from this list: 

Bodegas Mas Alta Priorat 2012
Bodegas Príncipe de Viana Garnacha Roble (2012)
Casas del Mar Rosé Cava (NV) 
Mont Marcal Cava Brut Reserva (2011) 
Liotro Sicilia Nero d'Avola (2013) 
Picco del Sole Vermentino di Sardegna (2014) 

There also will be:

Local artisan cheese
Homemade hummus

And, best of all, the tasting  will be led by Robin Kelley O'Connor, one of New York's leading wine experts and educators.


Robin is a wine instructor at the International Culinary Center and was previously Lead Specialist & Head of Wine, Americas for Christie’s Auction House, Director of Sales and Education for Manhattan wine and spirits retailer Sherry-Lehmann, and Trade Liaison and director of trade and consumer education in the Americas for the Bordeaux Wine Bureau (Conseil Interprofessionnel du Vin de Bordeaux) for 20 years. Robin holds Certified Specialist of Wine (CSW) and Certified Wine Educator (CWE) certifications from the Society of Wine Educators and passed the Court of Master Sommeliers’ Certified Sommelier exam. O'Connor served as president of the Society of Wine Educators from[masked], is on the board of directors of the New York Chapter of the American Institute of Wine & Food, and has been a regular panelist at the Food and Wine Magazine Classic in Aspen for 20 years.
results.name: Mediterranean Summer Wines: First Neighborhood Winetasting

results.description:
The August Comic Book Club poll winner was Rat Queens Vol 1: Sass & Sorcery by Kurtis J. Wiebe!

Bio: The Rat Queens are a tough, insouciant gang of ne’er-do-well girls (they’re certainly not ladies) who love a good bar brawl. When they are assigned a mission as punishment for their latest recklessness by the mayor of Palisade and it turns out to be a trap, Hannah, Violet, Dee, and Betty come back to the town to figure out who has it in for them and the other local fighting gangs. And if they have to beat up a few people and monsters to do it, then that’s just fine by them. Wiebe and Upchurch offer readers three-dimensional female characters with varying body types, races, sexual orientations, and backstories, while also including all the intriguing side characters, crude language, drug use, magic, violence, and sarcasm that a humorous, adult action-fantasy volume should have. Upchurch’s art has beautiful depth, and his panels glow with life. Offer this to readers tired of the same old comics featuring cheesecake depictions of female characters or to readers who like intelligent plots with a side of smart aleck. 

Purchase: 


Amazon
Barnes & Noble
Comixology

Or your local comic book store!
results.name: August Comic Club - Rat Queens Vol 1:  Sass & Sorcery

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

This is going to be an interesting evening!  Join us as we get to watch the first of the presidential candidates face off in the Republican Candidate debates.  You will see the top 10 candidates square off with each other.  Arrive at 7:pm for socializing and cocktails, grab a bite to eat then sit back and catch all the action on dozens of large monitors.The debate starts at 9pm

*********************************************************************

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season and is open to all. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

*******************************************************************

Do I have to be a Republican to attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all to get an idea of what the candidates are all about.  We will have parties for the Democratic Debates as well

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear?  Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

Is there food available?  Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.

If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.name: Book Club discusses major theory of religion -- Scott Atran on human cognition

results.description:
Using our knowledge of the evolution of cognition, cognitive anthropologist and psychologist Scott Atran argues that religion is a by-product of human evolution just as the cognitive intervention, cultural selection, and historical survival of religion is an accommodation of certain existential and moral elements that have evolved in the human condition. We’ll focus our discussion on Chapters 1 and 10 of this very important and impressive book. — All formats

Join us even if you haven’t finished reading. The SHSNY Book Club is open to all ... and free!

If you’re an Umbraco fan, or just curious about the premier open source ASP.Net Content Management System, come on out to our meetup and hang out with some friendly folks and enjoy light snacks. Afterward there is an option to head out for drinks or dinner nearby.

At our August meeting:

Heather Floyd will talk about her experience at this year’s CodeGarden conference, including takeaways from the keynote and sessions such as: improvements in deployment tools, segmentation & personalization options, and the most interesting new packages.

Dallas Taylor will discuss his integration work with Logstash “a data pipeline that helps you process logs and other event data from a variety of systems”.

Plus, everyone will be invited to share about projects they’re working on, questions & problems they’re facing, and favorite tools and processes.

results.description:
Come and join us. It is a great introduction to skating with a group of skaters.


Meet up at the West side of the Maine Monument fountain just inside the Columbus Circle entrance to Central Park. This is a free event but not a skating lesson.


While we will have Skate Patrol member(s) available to offer tips, it is not the place to learn to skate. It is important that you can already skate and slow down on hills and stop. You must be comfortable going both up and down hills. We will skate around the Central Park Loop. There will be an option for 5.2 miles or 6.1 miles depending on whether you cut across at the 102nd street transverse or do the entire loop to 110th St.

Because of the Big Apple Roll event this weekend, I expect a larger group of participants  this week. Come and meet some new skaters, some of which will be from out of town.

You might also consider participating in the BAR. The BAR is NOT a Skate Patrol event but we will be there to help. All are welcome to join in. To participate you must be able to control your speed and stop, skate safely in groups, and be comfortable skating in the streets of NYC with potholes, hills, and traffic. Skate routes will be from 10 to 20 miles long.

- For information about the "BAR"
http://www.empireskate.org/bigappleroll/

In case of RAIN, please note: 

This event will be cancelled if the Park Drive Roads are wet. 

-----------------------

I will be down early a little early tonight to offer skating tips to those who would like some help with breaking or to improve their skating. Meet me at Skater's Road Just west of the Band-shell in Central Park. See link below for map. I should be there by 6:15 PM.

results.description: As stated in Mathew Ramirez Warren’s new documentary, Latin boogaloo is New York City—a colorful expression of ’60s Latino soul straight from the streets of El Barrio, the South Bronx, and Brooklyn. Boogaloo godfather Joe Bataan unites doo-wop charm and Latin sounds in his irresistible hits. Ray Lugo’s good-time, hip-swinging originals pay homage to the style’s greats, including his specials guests, legendary pianist Richie Ray, and in one of his first performances in 40 years, Pete Rodriguez. ABAKUÁ Afro-Latin Dance Company will perform some of its signature choreography. To get the party started, in-demand DJ Turmix will spin Boogaloo gems.
results.name: Boogaloo celebration- joe bataan & ray lugo

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.name: East River Park Track Workout

results.description:
Attention Westchester Business Owners:

Warning! Don’t Even Think About Redesigning Your Website Or Advertising Online Until You Read This:

Experts say that 98% of people who visit your site leave without taking any action!

Dear Westchester Business Owner,

Does it drive you crazy that no matter how much money you spend on your website, you still don’t get any real, measurable bottom line results?

Have you ever wondered why other business owners seem to be raking it in on the web, while you’re struggling to make payroll?

Have you ever dreamed of having your site be a true 24 hour salesperson for you that actually brings in sales while you sleep?

if so..

Read on. You’re about to discover the “Animal Planet Website Trick” that can increase your website sales 3 to 10 times in as little as 48 hours- without expensive site redesigns, SEO, or endless social media updates. 

If you’ve invested a nice chunk of change in your website, you’re probably not happy with a paltry 2% return on your hard earned dollars.

But what if there was a way to stay in touch with the 98% of your website visitors who left? 

What if you could get your message in front of your prospects after they leave your site? And give them several more chances to consider your offer?

Even better, what if this strategy typically converted prospects into buyers at a lower cost than other forms of online advertising?

It costs you less because you are advertising ONLY to buyers with intent. They already raised their hand by visiting your website but didn’t buy because life got in the way. Maybe they were at work, their kids started fighting, or even the cat jumped on the computer keyboard.

Imagine if you could recapture even just 20% of those lost prospects each month…how would that affect your business’ annual bottom line?

Introducing the “Animal Planet Website Turbocharge”:

Here’s how it works:

A prospect visits your site They are “Tagged” ( Like the catch and release wildlife on Animal Planet.) with something like a cookie on their computer. After they leave your site, the cookie allows you to put your ads in front of them while they are surfing on Facebook and other websites. You can actually target your ad to the specific page or product they looked at on your site! This according to Industry experts such as AdRoll leads to

3 to 10 times higher sales and conversions.


It’s like having a virtual list of everyone who visited your site.

Sound too good to be true? Major brands like Amazon, Microsoft, Zillow and even the Waldorf Astoria are now using this same strategy on you when you visit their sites. Have you ever looked at a product on Amazon and found it following you around the web?

This same technology, also known as retargeting or remarketing is now available to your business.

The Animal Planet Website Trick

Is 3 to 10 times more effective than online display advertising. Permits you to follow up with prospects

without having their email address.

Allows you to create a personalized sales experience for each and every visitor to your website by targeting your ad to the specific page they visited. Gives you the best possible chance to

bring lost prospects back for their first sale, and customers back for their next sale.

  Empowers you to be perceived as a sophisticated and powerful company by your prospects. Most businesses (including your competition) have not caught on yet, which gives you a significant advantage when you act now.

On August 6th, Certified Digital Marketer, Kyle McMurry will hold a live training session for FREE on this incredible, stealth technology. You will leave equipped to start using the Animal Planet Website Turbochage within as little as 48 hours.

Get started today getting more leads and sales from your website with The Animal Planet Website Turbocharge.

WARNING: This is one of the ONLY Ways you can truly transform your website from an expensive revolving door into a lean, mean lead and sales machine. However your chance will be gone soon.

THIS EVENT IS SOLD OUT FOR MEN. WE HAVE SPOTS AVAILABLE FOR WOMEN ONLY.

Speed dating is the most effective way for men and women to meet. Nothin' beats meeting someone face to face in a nice and safe environment. Join us for an unforgettable night of speed dating, where you will meet up to 10 singles just like you in one FUN evening!

How does it work?

You will go on about 10 dates with someone of the opposite sex, each date will be 5 minutes long/short. We will provide you with materials to tell us who you liked. If the same person(s) you pick also pick you, you will be a "Match" and we will give you each others' contact information - then the rest is up to you! Call each other up and make plans to go out!

Recommended ages: Men 25-38, Women 23-36

Tickets are $20 if you RSVP on our Meetup group. We cannot accept walk-ins because we need to ensure an equal number of men and women.

PS: We are promoting this event on several Asian professionals groups, so don't go by the amount people you see RSVP on our Meetup alone - we assure you we will have a good amount of men and women participate at our event.

results.description:
What happens after coding bootcamp? Join us for a lively panel discussion with alumni from Dev Bootcamp's New York Campus. They will be joined members of our career services team to discuss what kinds of jobs Dev Bootcamp grads get, what kinds of companies they work for, and what their post-Dev Bootcamp work lives are like. Topics covered will include:

What kind of companies do they work for? Big companies? Small companies? Tiny startups? Technical consulting firms? EdTech? FinTech? Freelance gigs? Apprenticeships?

 What kind of work do they do? Web development? QA? DevOps? Technical consulting? Mobile development? Front-end? Back-end? Full-stack? Ruby? JavaScript? Python? PhP? HTML/CSS? 

What are their work days like? Fun? Collaborative? Stressful? Educational? Challenging? Fast-paced? Casual? Flexible? Team-oriented? Solitary? Remote? 

What was their job search like? What strategies did they use to get their job? What tips do they have for current and prospective bootcamp students?

results.description:
Designed by the principals of the famous Japanese architecture office SANAA (Kazuyo Seijima + Ryue Nishizawa). The New Museum on 235 Bowery offers free thursday sessions (suggested tip $2.00) to access contemporary art and it's rooftop!

About the Architects

Horror stories have been heard about SANAA, the architecture giants of Japan. Some say their interns don't sleep, some say their junior architects live off bread and water, but most say their work is the state of art. You may have visited Tokyo and came across the Christian Dior Building in Omotesandou. And from the same architects, they give you The New Museum in NYC. 

Interview with the architects:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=p189Fxs4lmw

So... long story short. Put on your artsy cap, whether you work in banking, science, I.T. or in the local gelato shop. Let's take some time to appreciate this award winning architecture and the art showcased within!

P.S. We will be doing a gelato run after the museum!

See you all there!

Chris

results.description:
Now you can take a live Insanity class at Clove Lakes Park by Certified Insanity Fitness Instructors, Marie-Elena Aruta and Michelle McKenzie.  Bring a guest your first visit and your first class is 1/2 off.

This is a Strength Training, HIIT workout using your own body weight. You will BLAST away calories, while building strength and increasing your endurance. You will be working every muscle group in this class. Although, you will be building strength in your core throughout the entire class, there will be more emphasis and focus on that area in the last 8 minutes of this class. I take advanced level exercise drills to challenge even my elite athletes - my warriors. I show you how it's done at an advanced level, and then I take that exercise and I demonstrate that same exercise taking out the high intensity to bring it down to a beginner and intermediate level so that there are no excuses - this class rocks for all fitness levels. We start off easy, and we increase our intensity throughout each set. 


If you try out these classes, you will love them and want more. 


A revoloutanary  cardio-based total-body conditioning program is based on the principles of MAX interval training. INSANITY pushes the participants to new training heights, resulting in more calories burned, faster results and more efficient metabolism. This interval training is the pinnacle of cardio training. You don't have to be in extreme shape - levels of each exercise are provided.
Insanity's not your traditional interval workout. It replaces traditional moderate-intensity exercise with maximum-intensity exercise, and trades short intervals of intensity for short periods of rest. The secret? Long periods of explosive intensity. You’ll do cardio and plyometric drills with intervals of strength, power, resistance, and core training. With Insanity, you can burn up to 1,000 calories in an hour. Participants experience faster increases in cardiovascular fitness and burn carbohydrates and fat more efficiently.

Class Description:
PLYOMETRICS for insane legs and gluts, UPPER BODY RESISTANCE for sculpted arms, shoulders, chest, and back. PURE CARDIO for crazy fat burn and CARDIO ABS with intensive core work so you can get awesome abs. 50 minutes: All Levels Welcome!
☆☆☆$10.00 for a limited time only☆☆☆

results.description:
Sometimes it's helpful to write in a group. So in this meeting we're coming together to just write. No critiques, no audiences (unless you want one), no pressure but that which you put on yourself. Here's how it works:


Part 1: 7:00- 7:45 we will write from a prompt provided by the organizer or one of the attending members.


Part 2: 7:50 - 9:50 is dedicated time for free writing. Work on whatever you want. We'd hope that work generated during these sessions will be submitted to any of the other Meetups or for broadcast on our podcast, Kaleidocast.


Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

See you there!
results.name: Dan's BSFW Writing Room

results.description:
Come all who care to be alive in their creativity! Come and increase your zest for life and the dynamic joy of performance! We shall do the ancient pastime and indeed the art and magic of STORYTELLING… Not the big theater, not any remote concept, but the kind of storytelling we do in our own natural way of connecting with others we do quite deftly and rather often. Just listen to people talk to one another in a casual encounter - and you will find a story in there - even in such a small thing as a recounting of a visit to a dentist or the recent gardening or house improvement event…

You can join this gathering every month - learn and share - there will be guidance provided towards improving your breathing, speaking, singing, and moving! In other words, we will progress our skills of storytelling presentation - same set of skills that you can use to present yourself in many other life's situations - professional and personal.

Do you need to have acting talent, you may ask? Nah, I will answer - talent does not an actor make, but… what does? Well, come and find out, and having heaps of fun in the process! Guaranteed!
results.name: Storytelling Garage

results.description:
Celebrate Black Follicles while highlighting the social injustice of unequal hair rights. 

</a>

<a href="http://badhairuprooted.com/store/publications/6-bad-hair-uprooted-a-celebration-of-black-follicles">BAD HAIR Uprooted brings to light the social injustice that Black people don't have the fundamental human right to wear their tresses natural.

The pictured hairdos—like Afros, Dreadlocks and Cornrows, are perfectly natural for African strands— yet are still stereotyped and considered fads unfit for the workplace with devastating consequences for Black follicles. 73% of African American women are suffering from relaxer-induced alopecia, hair loss related to chemical straighteners.

About
Drs. Mireille Liong-A-Kong, is a Social Entrepreneur who holds a Masters Degree in IT. Overcoming relaxer induced alopecia, a hair loss condition that affects 73% of African American women, inspired her to shoot for justice, publish Going Natural, How to Fall in Love with Nappy Hair, and create going-natural.com, America's Next Natural Model, BAD Hair Uprooted, the Going Natural Video Diaries and the Going Natural hair care line.
results.how_to_find_us: Cross street Jefferson
results.name: BAD HAIR UPROOTED Exhibition

results.description:
We will all meet in Room #2 at Info commons.

If you need to exercise your imagination and writing skills, then you may want to join a group of like minded individuals that do just that. We currently meet on Thursday evenings at 7pm. Once a month. Your hostess, for PROM(pt) evening will be our CO-Organizer, Inna.

Writing will commence with a prompt. Whatever comes to your mind about the prompt can be used in your piece. Once the prompt is given the writer's will have 15 to 18 minutes to write a poem, play or flash fiction piece on the subject of the Prompt. The Hostess will stop the clock and go around the room asking people who would like to share their story. After the author has read his story we will go around the room and ask for the members to tell us what  they thought of the way it was written and what they think is memorable about the story or if any part of the piece struck them as creative. 

Come down to Prom(pt) night and get creative.

We will be meeting at Info Commons Room#2.
results.name: Attend A PROM(pt) Night Sponsored by NYC Writers Workshop

results.description:
Where: Frederick Johnson - Court 8
 When: 7 pm - 8 pm
Level: Beginners and Advanced Beginners (but all welcome)
Max Players: 10 


How to RSVP for the next Tennis Lesson:

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 class = $35 Promo code = T15GR1

3 classes = $99 Promo code = T15GR3

6 classes = $179 Promo code = T15GR6

10 classes  = $269 Promo code = T15GR10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the the MindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on your MindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS:

These beautiful tennis courts are conveniently located at the end of the 3 train in Manhattan, which means they are just one block north. The surface is softer than most, well maintained, and has LIGHTS.


https://www.google.com/maps/place/2601+Adam+Clayton+Powell+Jr+Blvd,+New+York,+NY+10039/@40.8258611,-73.936799,17z/data=!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c2f67f79c87e27:0xba25e4f78a0fd23a

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

http://www.tennisworldnyc.com/where-to-play/

venue.name: Pivotal Labs

results.description:
How SmartNews expanded into the US market

We are super excited to announce our upcoming event, featuring SmartNews, a Japanese startup that is even popular in the US! Expect to learn about:

• How SmartNews got started

• How to bring Japanese services to the US market and capture US customers

• Feedback from North American users

We are also planning to have an interactive discussion with the SmartNews team.

If you want to learn about cross-cultural business between US-Japanese markets, discover new technology, and meet other enthusiastic technologists, please come and join us at Pivotal Labs! (and hang out afterwards at a bar nearby)

Agenda: 

-6:30pm  Door opens/ Networking
-7:00pm  Opening Remarks        
-7:15pm   Speaker : Kosuke Fujitaka - Media Business Development, SmartNews
                  Group Discussion for SmartNews Business
-8:00pm  Announcements & Open Networking

About SmartNews
SmartNews is the news discovery app used by millions around the world, winning multiple “App of The Year” awards. Its powerful machine learning algorithms evaluate more than 10 million articles and signals a day to help you discover the 10-20 most interesting and important stories that matter right now.

Speaker 
Kosuke Fujitaka

Media Business Development, SmartNews
As a cross-cultural ambassador, Kosuke joined SmartNews as its first US-based employee to help the company expand. Currently, he helps US publisher partners engage new audiences with SmartNews. Previously, Kosuke was a financial controller at Sony Ericsson and co-founded TokyoArtBeat and NYArtBeat.

A special thanks to Pivotal Labs for providing us a space for our event!

We hope that this event will be a place where Japan & NY people can come collaborate. Looking forward to seeing you all!

Masa, Yu & Toby

results.description:
Important note. You DO NOT NEED to bring something for "show and tell". Please attend for any reason you choose! All are welcome!


----


We all know that Harry Potter fans are some of the most creative around. But the occasions to show off your creations are few and far between.

So for August, we are holding a Fandom gallery and show and tell!

Bring to the meetup any of your creative endeavors, whether its a costume you designed, a fanfic you wrote, fan art you drew, a collection you amassed, jewelry you designed, etc. and we will do our best to put it on display in the Uno's private room for an hour or so while we eat.

Then we will have our show and tell portion, where you can come up if you choose and tell the group about your creative endeavor.

Any form of creative expression is fine! It can be HP or another fandom, geeky or not geeky. Whatever you are most proud of and want to show off!

If you are bringing multiple items (to show off part of a collection or a set of jewelry, or a series of art prints for example), please use reason with how many you bring. We have limited space to show off your work and limited time to ensure everyone gets to talk about their creative works.
results.how_to_find_us: We sit in the private seating area in the back

results.description:
Where: Frederick Johnson Park - Tennis Court #8

Level and When: Every Thursdays

Beginner Group Class: 7:00 pm - 8:00 pm


Max Players: 10  

           WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

                       ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

Promotional Prices on All Lessons and Classes:

TennisWorldNYC.com/pricing/

Single Group Lesson Cost: $35 

or

Promotional Bulk Group Package Price:  

Buy a package of 3, 6 or 10 Sessions and Save.  The cost of the sessions range in price pending the package you purchase form $27-$33.  Just create an account (New To Our Site) with Username and Password to obtain this offer and Make sure you use the Promo Code from the Pricing Page to obtain your discount:

TennisWorldNYC.com/pricing/ 

Payments and securing your reservation for a group class or private lesson must be made via your account on the link below:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Any questions or problems, feel free to call[masked]-7141.

Important Note 1:  People who have created an account on MindBodyOnline, purchased a package and RSVP'd on MindBodyOnline will have preference at the time of the lesson over people who have not pre-paid and created a MindBodyOnline account.

So create and account on the link above, purchase your package or lesson and RSVP for the class of your choice to always be guaranteed a spot for your class.

Even More Important Note 2: Unable to attend the class?  If you change your RSVP on the the MindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on your MindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show.  I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting with other students
- Racquet available if necessary

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916


Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS: Frederick Johnson Park

Subway

Take the #3 (Red Line) Express Train to the 148th Street subway stop.
Walk 1 minute North to the Frederick Johnson Tennis Courts.

OR

Take the A, B, C or D Trains to 145 Street and St Nicholas, walk east on 145th Street to Adam Clayton Powell Boulevard and north to the tennis courts at 150th street. Total walking time about 10 minutes.

Car

Drive towards 7th Avenue and West 150th Street where you will find plenty of parking on the street or on drive up the ramp to the school next to the park and easily park your car there.

Walk or Bike

Arrive to 7th Avenue and West 150th Street, 2619 Adam Clayton Powell Jr Blvd

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

http://www.tennisworldnyc.com/where-to-play/

Like us on Facebook to see great photos and videos of past classes at:

www.Facebook.com/TennisWorldNYC

Thanks so much! Looking forward to a great 2015 season.

TennisWorldNYC.com

results.description:
People Who Get Ahead In Life

Are Those Who Can Communicate Effectively.

Wouldn't You Like To Develop This Priceless Skill?

Now You Can!”

Come to  West Side Talkers  and Get on The Road to Becoming The Best Speaker in Your Neck of the Woods!

Develop your public speaking skills in a Fun, Warm, Friendly and Enthusiastic environment. 

Ralph Waldo Emerson once said, “All great speakers were bad speakers at first”. Emerson was right because great speakers are not born; they are made!

But in order to transform yourself into a great speaker you have to show up! Woody Allen said it best.  "80 percent of success is  just by showing up. " 

West Side Talkers is vibrant toastmasters club that's creative and thinks out-of-the-box. Over the years we have incorporated additional valuable segments that we offer at our club which have been added on top of the already great Toastmasters model. At our club, our members do speeches and we provide constructive evaluations, and we host table topics, thought of the day, word of the day, etc. (These are all part of the Toastmasters model)

At West Side Talkers you will experience everything that a toastmasters club can offer and more. We take all the great things that are in the Toastmasters program and we take it up a few notches (well maybe more than a few!) so that we can bring more value to our members and guests.

Below are the ADDITIONAL ITEMS that we have incorporated into our meeting agenda which add more value to our members speaking development. (not part of the Toastmasters model)

SPEAKING TIP

Where you will pick up a valuable Speaking Tip by a Certified World Class Speaking coach which you can immediately use in your very next speech.

IMPROV COMEDY

As a member of West Side Talkers we take you through "actual" improv exercises to help you develop your emotional expressiveness, characterizations, and your spontaneity in your speaking more quickly and efficiently. Improv can help you FAST TRACK your speaking development and do it WHILE HAVING FUN!

COMMERCIAL MINUTE

IF you were asked at a networking luncheon to get up and talk for 60 seconds about your business and what you do, would you be able to do it effectively? As a member of West Side Talkers we can help you learn how to deliver effective 60 second commercials.

Please contact us via email if you have any questions about our exciting program.

At our “West Side Talkers” Toastmasters public speaking meetings we encourage people to challenge themselves and get up and speak. However, we do not force anyone to do so. You can learn a lot by just attending our meetings. By just coming to our meeting you have made an initial step towards challenging your fears...!!!

So whether you just want to conquer your fear of public speaking or you want to become a Champion Speaker – “West Side Talkers” will help you get there!

If you have ever been to other Toastmasters public speaking clubs, at West Side Talkers, you will experience a Toastmasters club like no other. Come To Our Next West Side Talkers Meeting and Experience it For Yourself!

When:

Thursday August 6th,  2015  7:00pm - 9:00pm

The Jewish Center 131 West 86th Street, 10th floor (between Columbus and Amsterdam)  New York, NY 10024

Cost:

$6  (this helps cover our overhead)  Pay at Door or Pay online By CLICKING HERE 

Reservation is Required! 

Please RSVP to ([masked] or [masked])

results.description:
A historic literary event: the publication of a newly discovered novel, the earliest known work from Harper Lee, the beloved, bestselling author of the Pulitzer Prize-winning classic, To Kill a Mockingbird.

Originally written in the mid-1950s, Go Set a Watchman was the novel Harper Lee first submitted to her publishers before To Kill a Mockingbird. Assumed to have been lost, the manuscript was discovered in late 2014.

Go Set a Watchman features many of the characters from To Kill a Mockingbird some twenty years later. Returning home to Maycomb to visit her father, Jean Louise Finch—Scout—struggles with issues both personal and political, involving Atticus, society, and the small Alabama town that shaped her.

Exploring how the characters from To Kill a Mockingbird are adjusting to the turbulent events transforming mid-1950s America, Go Set a Watchman casts a fascinating new light on Harper Lee’s enduring classic. Moving, funny and compelling, it stands as a magnificent novel in its own right.
results.name: August 2015 - GO SET A WATCHMAN

results.description:
Please join us on Thursday evening for a 6 mile, casual-pace loop run.

We will meet just inside the 52nd Street entrance to Windmuller Park at 7:15pm and head out for a 6ish mile loop through Woodside, Sunnyside, LIC, and Greenpoint, before returning to the start. We won't set a minimum pace requirement for this run. But, please be sure that you can comfortably run a full 6 miles without stopping before deciding to participate.

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. This can mean we will wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt. 

If there is interest after we complete our run, we may venture to a pub for snacks and/or beverages.

Note that this run is held rain, snow or shine. In the event of very nasty weather or hazardous conditions, notice will be posted online, and all who RSVP will receive an email alert advising of any change in plans.

Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].

This is going to be an interesting evening!  Join us as we get to watch the first of the presidential candidates face off in the Republican Candidate debates.  You will see the top 10 candidates square off with each other.  Arrive at 7:pm for socializing and cocktails, grab a bite to eat then sit back and catch all the action on dozens of large monitors.The debate starts at 9pm

*********************************************************************

This event is meant to be a fun and interesting way to kick off the political season and is open to all. If you attend all we ask is that if you feel strongly about any candidate you keep your comments educated and dignified.  If you feel like you may get too passionate and cause arguing we would appreciate if you watched at home!

*******************************************************************

Do I have to be a Republican to attend? NO. NO. NO! This event is open to all to get an idea of what the candidates are all about.  We will have parties for the Democratic Debates as well

Can I come alone? Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What should I wear?  Most people are coming from work so they will have on their work clothes, business casual

Is there food available?  Yes they have an awesome menu, separate checks no problem.

If there does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

Come AWOL with us! (After Work Origami Lovers)


After a long week what could be better than meeting with friends and potential new friends to fold your work week away! Come fold with us at AWOL!

Its a lot of fun and more intimate than our once a month big meetings. A great place to learn some new models and also get help on models you're been stuck on. Bring your latest folds and creations for show and tell and your favorite models to teach and learn.

We meet at the same Cosi on 6th ave between 22nd and 23rd every week. it's a great meeting spot and a perfect place to fold.

This meeting is free and open to all level of folders from beginners to advanced. bring paper and your books and also there will always be free paper available to share so you can just show up and fold!

please try to RSVP so others will know you will be there.

hope to see you there! happy folding!!

-Sok

NOTE: Please try to RSVP if possible so others will know you will be there. Thanks.

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.name: Happiness and its Distractions  7:30-9pm at Barnes & Noble in White Plains

EagleMania

EagleMania-The World’s Greatest Eagles Tribute Band. That isn’t their slogan by mistake. EagleMania has dedicated itself to faithfully reproducing the sound of The Eagles for the past three years. Since their inception, EagleMania has been thrilling audiences all over the East Coast with their stunning five part harmonies and their uncanny ability to emulate The Eagles note by note. results.description:
Join us as we discuss the novel The Ocean at the End of the Lane by Neil Gaiman. Copies of the novel will be available for pick up at the Paramus Public Library (116 East Century Road) one month before the meeting. 

Novels at Night is  a book club for adults 21 years and older who enjoy reading and sharing their opinions about books. Join us monthly at the 9 Iron Grille (314 Paramus Road) to meet new people, sample great food** and drinks, and discuss books in a relaxed atmosphere.


A review from Publisher's Weekly:

"Childhood memories are sometimes covered and obscured beneath the things that come later... but they are never lost for good"-and the most grim of those memories, no matter how faint, can haunt one forever, as they do the anonymous narrator of Gaiman's subtle and splendid modern myth. The protagonist, an artist, returns to his childhood home in the English countryside to recover his memory of events that nearly destroyed him and his family when he was seven.
results.name: The Ocean at the End of the Lane by Neil Gaiman

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
***Note: This event is for experienced players only (NTRP rating 3.0 and above)***



Join us for Summer Tennis at Lincoln Park under lights till 11 pm. 

Upon arrival, check in at the Clubhouse before proceeding to the courts.

Please follow these GUIDELINES for an enjoyable tennis session:


1. Members shall meet outside the Clubhouse at the scheduled time.

2. First two to arrive shall reserve a court with the Clubhouse staff. 

3. Post the details (court #, names of players) on meetup comments, and then start playing.


4. As more members arrive, they may join in on the posted court# if space is available (max. 4 players per court), while continuing to update the player count on the comments.

5. If the posted court is full, wait till at least one other player arrives, and then reserve a new court. Then repeat from step 3. :-)

Important Information Regarding Court Reservations:


• Reservation is free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as guests of the residents to avoid a possible $10 fee.


• Minimum two players must be present to reserve a court.

RSVP Etiquette:

• Please keep your RSVP updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

• No shows may be bumped from future events.

Inclement weather cancels the event.


If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.


Thank you all for this great group!

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
“Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord” (Ps 33:12, KJV)

Please join the Christian Party of America’s monthly Town Hall Conference Call to discuss current political issues with like-minded Christians. The conference call is the first Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM est. (7:30 PM central). Don Watson, National Vice-Chairman and North Carolina State Chairman will lead the discussion on what can be done to address the concerns we all share for the status of our country’s civil government. Earl Grover, National Board Member and Director of the Christian Men in Leadership and Veterans of the Constitution Divisions will lead us in prayer and spiritual insight about how we as Christians can turn our country back to its Christians heritage.

The Christian Party of America’s nationwide Conference Calls are a great opportunity to connect with other Christian Party supporters as we try to make a difference in this country. So sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. Our conference calls are open to the public and are for all of us who are interested in the Christian Party of America. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!

The conference call will last for about an hour and a half, but staying for the entire call is optional. If you get a message that the circuits are busy, just keep trying the number and it eventually works. There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call. You can even listen in to the conference call while at other events...just hit *6 to mute your phone and you can do two things at once!
results.name: Christian Party Town Hall Conference Call

results.description:
Tango Thursdays - Live Tango Music since 2009

This week: Adam Tully Trio

Adam Tully - guitar and host

Emilio Teubal- piano

Pedro Giraudo - bass

Our night is more than a live music show: it's a social and cultural event and it turns the cozy Pane e Vino into a magic place for a few hours every week:

A regular crowd travels from as far as Philadelphia and as near as around the corner each week to meet up for a glass of wine, dinner or dessert.

Dancers socialize, listen to the band, and dance a few numbers, one, two, or three couples at a time.

It's a pretty regular occurrence that one of our tango-singer friends shows up to sing one or two tangos.

Many of our friends choose to celebrate their birthdays with us.

We have such a great time at Tango Thursdays - you should too!
results.how_to_find_us: We're in the band!
results.name: Tango Thursdays Meetup

***REGISTRATION closes 45 minutes prior to the webcast.***  Please make sure you sign-up on our website at least 45 mins prior to the webcast to receive your live log-in link via email.


(Technical Support: <a>[masked]</a>)


The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the fundamental of life energy within. 

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Challenge with The Rise
