results.description:
Join us if you'd like to be featured!

Featuring:

Jeff Novich is a Senior Product Manager at ClassPass.  ClassPass is a membership program for fitness classes across multiple gyms and studios, making working out more accessible.

Previously, Jeff ran product for Grockit, a test-prep platform, for Kaplan Test Prep. Before that he was the mobile product manager for Groundlink, a car service. Jeff's passion for product and startups runs deep: He's a 12x hackathon winner (most recently picking up the Microsoft Outlook top prize at Techcrunch Disrupt), 2x Techstars participant and 3x startup builder. 

You can view his many projects at www.jeffnovich.com. When he's not working, you can find Jeff reading to his 2-year-old son Jack, walking his greyhound Sagan, or doing chores to keep his wife Maddy happy. 

Fun fact: Jeff was an on-camera stand-in for Bobby Flay on Iron Chef America for 7 seasons.

Village Tech Breakfast:

We'll do a round of introductions, followed by another round of questions for our featured guest. It's fun fast and interactive. Then we'll stay and chat as long as people like.

Recommended:

For more dining options with designers, developers and entrepreneurs, check out:

results.description:
Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am. 

Class fee is $12, or $10 for seniors.
results.name: Chair Yoga Class

results.description:
American Princess Cruise Line's ; Rock Away Ferry will take us to Riis Beach. Don't you want to spend a day at the ocean beach sometime this Summer? We leave from Pier 11. Location + Wall Street and the East river, between the South Street Seaport , and the Heliport. Ferry leaves at 11;30am for this one hour ride to Riis beach. At 5:30pm, Ferry leaves Riis beach and returns to pier 11. View NY harbor, the statue of liberty, the Verrazano Narrows bridge, Cony Island, Jamaica Bay, etc., etc.
price = $30.00 round trip. Capacity = 250 and there is an open bar. Please check the websites of Riis Beach and the Rock a way Ferry for more details and information. This area offers a lot more than just sitting in the sun, or walking the beach. What would you like to do at Riis Beach?.... Let me know so we can work out a strategy.

results.description:
Living in a city where one is constantly ‘on’ and looking to do more and more, a workshop that will recharge you and open you up to tap into a practical way to refresh every day, so you can do more of the things you love doing.

Each one of us possesses the ability to calm the mind and recharge the body within minutes. The secret lies in the breath.

This 60 min workshop is an introduction to the Art of Living Happiness Program. We will explore breath and meditation as well as other tools which are taught on the Happiness Program.


When: Fridays at 1pm. Please
arrive early for seating and registration

No need to bring anything but yourself – Yoga mats, water, back-jacks, pillows and blankets are all supplied at the center.
results.name: Breathe Meditate and Rejuvenate !

results.description:
What do you get when you combine a guided tour of the city with a professional photography lesson? Come find out at one of our weekly New York City Photographic Safaris! 

 We will put you in the shoes of a professional travel photographer as our pro photographers guide you on a walking tour around New York City. Your guide will ensure you see and photograph the very best NYC has to offer as you explore both the well-known landmarks, and the hidden photo spots around the city.

 Not only will you see the sights through the eyes of a travel photographer, you'll quickly become one yourself as our local pros teach and guide you on how to achieve postcard-perfect photos at every stop.

Date: Aug 7 - 1pm - 3hr

*Use promo code SUMMERFLING for 25% off*

Ticket at: https://goo.gl/4cJS5E

results.description:
Join us and Foster Dogs NYC at Sean Casey Animal Rescue's (SCAR) Windsor Terrace shelter on Friday, August 7th from 3:00pm to 5:00pm! Spend the afternoon outside exploring the area with wonderful adoptable dogs.  


August is also SCAR's month for our Steps Fur Pets campaign. You can participate and support SCAR as you walk with the free ResQwalk app! Each week, ResQwalk divides a donation pool (about $850) between animal rescues around the country. The more miles logged, the more money each rescue receives. 

Volunteers must be 18+ and must fill out a dog walking volunteer form. Each walk is about 15-45 minutes, depending on how long you (or the dog!) want to stay out. You can walk as many dogs as you like. 

You can print the dog walking volunteer form in advance to save some time at the shelter, but it's not required: http://nyanimalrescue.org/wp-content/uploads/2014/04/SCAR-Dog-Walker-Package-MAIN1.pdf.

If you're bringing a friend along, just know that you will only be able to walk one dog at a time if you walk together. Dogs are not allowed to walk together. 

We can't wait to see you there!
results.name: Walk Dogs at Sean Casey Animal Rescue

Hi Everyone,

I am so happy that we are all set for our Meetup for Friday, August 7, 2015.

It will start at:

Omonia Cafe

7612 3rd Avenue in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn

(between 76th and 77th Street)

@  3:30 PM

Here is the website:

http://omoniacafe.com/bayridge/

Following our meal at Omonia Cafe, we will continue with The Summer Stroll from 6PM - 10 PM.  It takes place along 3rd Avenue from 69th - 80th Streets in Bay Ridge.  A lovely time should be had by all.

You can RSVP beginning on:

Monday, July 27, 2015, @ 8 PM.  

As always, please bring CASH ONLY for whatever you eat and drink. 

• The management has agreed to give us separate checks and will add on tax and a 20% tip for our waiter or waitress to each check.

• Upon arrival, there will be a $2.00 Meetup fee.

                  ******Please be considerate of others. **********

 If you need to change your RSVP from a YES to a NO, for any reason, please

do so by Tuesday, August 4, 2015 @ 11 AM.  If you are on the waiting list and realize that you cannot attend please change to a NO by August 4th as well.

RSVP's will close on:

Thursday, August 6, 2015 @ 11 AM, in order to give an exact head count to the cafe.

I am looking forward to having a terrific time with a wonderful group of women.

All the best,
Michele

results.description:
Hi there,

We find ourselves challenged to maintain an environment that would encourage our kids to learn the German language and culture. Like many in the area, we live far from family that could provide more frequent interactions in German. Since our partners are English speaking, we'd like to create opportunities for our kids to experience German not only through interacting with us parents but also with others. Hence, we would love to build supporting networks with other parents and their babies & children that would like to interact and have fun(!) in German on a regular basis.


Since the summer is winding down we have to find a good place for the fall and those cold winter days : ) Any suggestions for good places for us to play or things to do are very welcome.

See you soon!

Maria & Renate

results.description:
EVENT TYPE: Night Life

ADMISSION COST: Free

PLEASE NOTE: Come anytime you like, Starts 4pm.

DESCRIPTION:

With its three plush corner Sky Pods overlooking Times Square, stylish indoor and outdoor seating options, the exclusive Waterford Crystal Lounge, the open-air Nat Sherman Cigar Lounge, an ultra-luxe private room, and lush living walls of greenery, St. Cloud is the ultimate rooftop bar in NYC. Named for the late-19th century hotel that originally occupied the site, St. Cloud is the pinnacle of The Knickerbocker experience, offering a progressive cocktail menu, craft bottled beers and an upscale, seasonally focused small plates menu. Sophisticated entertainment is an understated-yet-eclectic mix of cirque-like, biergarten and speak-easy fun, while curated music selections set the tone for extraordinary experiences high above the city.

MENU:

• Liquor

• Snacks

• Cocktails

results.description:
Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 4:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
results.how_to_find_us: Look for anyone wearing a orange or blue Pinnies.

results.description:
Come join fellow educators, coaches, and consultants in New York City teaching and selling online. Our (second) Friday of the month happy hour is a super casual event.

We're looking to foster a place where educators and technologists can discuss ways to teach and grow their own online courses. This is a quickly changing space, and only by sharing our insights can we truly keep up the pace of change with online education.

For tonight - you'll a premium selection of beer on tap available to facilitate conversation. A few of our team of 11 will hanging out and offering advice to anyone looking to launch a successful course or school online. Today, Fedora instructors work with over half a million students from around the world.

Reservations: We're looking to keep the group tight, so please keep your RSVPs up to date.

YOU MUST RSVP HERE TO ATTEND: http://www.eventbrite.com/e/summer-dranks-with-fedora-tickets-17921910918

The location: WeWork Chelsea (115 W 3rd Floor)
The Time: 6:00 - 9:00pm

Sponsor: Fedora will be providing space and sponsoring beer. If you have any ideas or thoughts feel free to shoot me a note at [masked]
results.name: Monthly Happy Hour

results.description:
Hello Skaters (And Bikers*)!

The Empire Skate Club of NY invites you to join us at our 13th Annual Big Apple Roll (BAR) Skate Weekend. August 7-9, 2015 in New York City!! We're busy planning our biggest event of the year. And we're VERY excited about our new location and Host Hotel in lower Manhattan (see separate posting).

100-200+ Skaters are coming from all around the country and globe to join BAR 2015.

It's a free, exciting weekend of group skates, partying, adventures, touring, exploring and experiencing New York City on skates. Party with old friends, make new ones & feel the rush of skating the City's streets. 

Enjoy the beautiful urban & natural scenery, rolling hills, historic bridges and fast straight-aways (if you like). City skating, island hopping, beaches, parks, nightlife and of course our skates through Times Square.

Central Park is also the capital of dance skating where you can join the world's greatest skate dancers and slalom skaters (cone-heads) for a truly unique experience. 

There are usually skates on Friday Night, Saturday Morning, Saturday Afternoon and Sunday Morning. There will be activities in-between skates, social gatherings at night & we will also be raffling off skates, skate bags, t-shirts, accessories and other swag from K2, Rollerblade, Transpack, RoadID and others. 

Please RSVP on FaceBook!!

https://www.facebook.com/events/1537344793221382/

Also check out our website at http://www.empireskate.org/ or http://www.bigappleroll.org/ Follow BAR links on the right side and view current info as well as photos from past events. 

HOST HOTEL INFO: 
See Separate Post

For questions & more information, send an email to [masked]. 

Note: * Bikers are welcomed as long as they keep in mind that skaters kick-out. Therefore, bikers must give skaters adequate space at all times.

**** REQUIRED****
ALL MUST BRING A GREAT ATTITUDE AND BIG SMILE FOR SKATING WITH GREAT FRIENDS & FUN PEOPLE!!! Everyone is also required to sign (and is subject to) our waiver/disclaimer. AND EVERYONE is also required to wear helmets and wrist guards (at the very least).

More Details when available......

WE CAN’T WAIT TO SKATE WITH YOU!!!

SEE YOU AT THE BAR!!!
results.name: Big Apple Roll - 2015

results.description:
RSVP'S open Wednesday 7/29 at 2pm.

Note: Optional social hour from 4:30pm at Sharlene's Bar.  Down home spot! Inexpensive drinks. Walking Tour begins by 5:30pm.  The concert in Prospect Park begins at 7:30pm. We'll arrive early enough for seats and food. Or don't sign up and meet the group at the concert. Make sure you have my cell # or someone else's who is attending.

Park Slope is the only neighborhood in NYC to have made it into the "Top Ten Neighborhoods in America", selected by the American Planning Association.  It contains some of the most beautiful and distinctive residential architecture of any NYC nabe, and we'll learn about its other unique qualities and history.

The tour will end at Prospect Park at the outdoor concert festival where you will find good food and drink for purchase, restrooms and some great music.  THIRD WORLD one of my favorite reggae bands - been around for 40 years. See link below:

http://bricartsmedia.org/events/performing-arts/third-world-awa-sangho

Cheers,

Hank

[masked]

results.description:
Weather: Hello Guys and Gals! Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.
Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

results.description:
On Friday August 7, 2015 at 5:00pm, the Haitian Community is invited to a FREE Family Concert. The event will feature Tabou Combo and Toto Laraque & Friends. We ask you to bring the whole family to enjoy this evening of fun and get together in the beautiful setting of Eisenhower Park. There will be many activities and great Caribbean food. Please bring your lawn chairs and blankets to the event.

 The Harry Chapin Lakeside Theatre is an outdoor theater located within Eisenhower Park in East Meadow.  Conveniently located near parking fields 6 and 6A, the theatre provides a venue for a full schedule of entertainment events during the summer. Special accommodations are also available for disabled patrons, including reserved parking, easily accessible restrooms and a convenient reserved location on the hill. If doubtful weather conditions arise, call[masked] for updated performance information.

http://www.rockmasters.com/blasts-2015/creole-family-day-2015.htm

We meet at NYC Guitar School,  

251 w 30th St on the 7th Floor (no longer 8th floor)

Check out some videos here:


"Rock Me Baby"

https://vine.co/v/MMOvEWDJTmM

https://vine.co/v/M5L7rPrJdzp

"Bad To The Bone"

https://vine.co/v/h26I1j3J0v7

Blues Jam

"

https://vine.co/v/h26XTIzVWeH

"


For beginners and intermediate players. (We are a very supportive crowd!)

We will warm up by strumming along to great songs then go over blues licks and jam!

BYOB Jam; Hang Out, Drink and Play!


Blues Jam Made Easy; work on pentatonic scales and seventh chords.

This will be a guided blues jam with room for improvement on all levels of playing.

Acoustic guitars are provided. There are a few amps for electric guitars if you bring yours. 

Bass players are welcome (bring your own bass) 

Ukelele players are welcome (bring your own uke)

results.description:
This is a nice very spacious bar, with decent drinks and food. It's located two short blocks away from the Broadway stop on the N &Q train line. 

From their site:

Break is LIC / Astoria’s most exciting entertainment venue. We are centrally located on Broadway between 32nd and 33rd streets just steps from trains and public transportation. Often referred to as an adult play-ground, Break offers numerous activities including Billiards, Ping-Pong, Darts, Vintage Arcades, Foosball, and Hoops!

With a 55 foot long bar that includes a rotating selection of 18 beers on tap, dozens in the bottle, as well as a full range of cocktail options, there is always something new to try. We also offer a full food menu with a great selection of American comfort food. With 16 true HD television displays, 2 giant projectors and state of the art audio and video capabilities, Break is also the area’s premier venue to watch all your favorite sports teams compete.

Whether you are out with a large group or on a first date, Break offers a perfect atmosphere that is unmatched in the area. 7000 square feet of exposed brick, massive industrial heating vents, and soaring 12-foot ceilings give the space a cool industrial feel that is sure to impress.

results.description:
We'll meet on the west side corner of 5th and 86th (Central Park side) at 5:30pm.


A Northern Manhattan Outside inside expedition :)


My wonderful co-organizer Mayra suggested a visit to the Neue Galerie on 5th and 86th. We had recently seen the movie 'Woman in Gold' and remembered the painting was now here in the city at the Neue Galerie. 

From their website;

"Neue Galerie New York is a museum devoted to early twentieth-century German and Austrian art and design, displayed on two exhibition floors. The second-floor galleries are dedicated to art from Vienna circa 1900, exploring the special relationship that existed then between the fine arts (of Gustav Klimt, Egon Schiele, Oskar Kokoschka, Richard Gerstl, and Alfred Kubin) and the decorative arts (created at the Wiener Werkstätte by such well-known figures as Josef Hoffmann, Koloman Moser, and Dagobert Peche, and by such celebrated architects as Adolf Loos, Joseph Urban, and Otto Wagner). " (http://www.neuegalerie.org/museum/about/mission-statement)


And as a bonus, the Neue Galerie offers free admission on the first Friday of the month (supported by a generous grant from the Wall Street Journal), 6pm to 8pm.


We are going on the first Friday in August and invite anyone in the group to join us.


We'll meet on the west side corner of 5th and 86th (Central Park side) at 5:30pm. I'm not sure if there will be a line for the 6pm entrance but if you are coming, do try to get there at 5:30 (I won't be able to hold a spot on line).


Afterwards we'll probably hit the cafe for coffee

Cameras are not allowed in the gallery, you can check them at coatcheck, but I'd suggest leaving cameras home :)


Check out their website at Neue Galerie
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be in an orange hat
results.name: First Friday Visit to Neue Galerie

results.description:
Our monthly group meet-up is a great way to meet up the group, socialize, catch-up, pitch, get support for your projects and just to have fun.

Agenda:

Informal Networking: Getting to know each-other. Specially useful for the new-comers.

Round-table: Members share who they are, what they do, what are they planning or intending to do and what kind of help or collaboration they need.

Review & Plan: Reviewing the progress done in the last month and the plan for the coming month.

Open Forum: Any ideas, suggestions, feedback etc.

Social: Going somewhere in the neighborhood to eat, drink and more chit-chat.

Parking: There is ample parking at the back of the property or at the side road.

Some of the projects:

Feature length film "Kites Day". Script is ready and the project requires funding.

Members are welcomed to bring any friends, food and drinks in the meeting.

Contact #:[masked] for any other information or help in directions etc.

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked].


Coney Island was once the Hamptons and Jersey Shore for many Manhattanites in the 1800's.  Filled with swanky hotels it because America's Playground for many years.  Join a fun group of NYSN members and friends for this great Friday Night on the Boardwalk.  You will have a chance to learn about the history of Coney Island from the Dutch Settlers to it's downfall and now it's rise from the ashes!  Along the way you will get to socialize with others, check out the games and rides and food plus enjoy an amazing Fireworks display on the beach.

How does it work?  You can meet the group at The Playwright Irish Pub on 35th and 6th from 5:30-6pm or meet the group at Nathan's in Cony Island at 7:30pm.  We will contact you after you register to confirm.  At Nathan's everyone can grab a beer and a hot dog then we will take the history tour up Surf Avenue and down the Boardwalk.  At 9:30 there will be a huge fireworks display.  After the fireworks you can leave or hang with members of the group and play games or go on rides.

Can I come alone? Yes 95% of those attending will be coming on their own

What to expect: 20-30 fun a friendly people looking to enjoy a unique night out

What to wear: summer casual/business casual if coming from work. Comfortable shoes

When does it end? The fireworks are over at 10pm.  You can stay at the bar with the group or leave anytime you'd like.

Can I meet the group in Coney Island?  Yes but you will need to contact [masked] to make arrangements.

What to bring: Metrocard for 2 trips

What if it rains? We will do the tour only if the weather allows.  We will contact you on the day of to keep you posted.

Age Restriction 21+

PLEASE BRING EXACT CHANGE $15 There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]
results.name: NY Tours for New Yorkers: Coney Island History, Firework's, Games & Rides!

THIS EVENT WAS POSTED BY THE FORMER ORGANIZER OF THIS GROUP AND I WOULD LIKE TO HONOR IT SINCE 11 PEOPLE HAVE ALREADY RSVPED FOR IT. HOWEVER, I WILL NOT BE ABLE TO LEAD IT.

IF ANYBODY WISHES TO LEAD IT, AND TAKE CHARGE FOR THE EVENING, IT WOULD BE GREATLY APPRECIATED. PLEASE KINDLY POST A COMMENT ON THIS PAGE SO PEOPLE KNOW WHO YOU ARE.  


IF NOBODY COMES FORWARD TO LEAD THIS EVENT, IT WILL NOT HAVE AN ORGANIZER.


Let's enjoy a summer evening in the beautiful sculpture garden of the Naguchi Museum while sipping a chilled glass of wine and making new friends.

For those who would like to join us, dinner will follow at Taste of Thai on Broadway, within walking distance from the subway. The exact address for the restaurant is 34-16 Broadway Astoria, NY 11106

On the first Friday of every month, the Museum offers visitors free admission and extended hours from 5:00 to 8:00pm with additional, special programming and a cash bar with wine and beer. At 7:00pm, visitors are invited to engage with the Museum’s collection through Center of Attention, an hour-long conversations around a single work of art.


DIRECTIONS TO THE MUSEUM:

please follow this link which will provide you with a plethora of options. 
I find he easiest way is to take the N/Q train to Broadway, and walk a short walk towards the river.

results.description:
And the winner by a huge margin is Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation. The people have spoken very clearly this time. The breakdown of votes is as follows:

Mission Impossible: Rogue Nation- 15

Vacation- 0

Southpaw- 2

Pixels- 0

We'll be catching the 6:30pm showing of Mission: Impossible Rogue Nation, and so we'll be meeting at 6:00pm in the lobby of the AMC Loews 34th Street 14 theater. 

After the movie, we'll be eating dinner at the Skylight Diner, about a block away from the theater. The food is decent and the service can be charmingly rude, but they accommodate very large groups easily, so we continue our humble patronage with them  

After dinner, for those who don't want the night to end, we'll head to a local bar and continue to expound on the virtues and merits (or lack thereof) of the movie over drinks- or we'll just talk and stuff. 

*I still have discounted ticket vouchers available. The normal ticket price is $14.79. The cost of the voucher is $11. Not a huge discount, but every little bit counts, right? If you're interested in reserving a voucher before the event, let me know and I'll send you the info you need. Any vouchers that haven't been reserved before the event will be available for cash purchase when we meet

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!


• Permit Disclosure: We have the permit.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine

(Leader- Ray Ray)

(co-leader- Francisco)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME - 5.45PM!! 

• Game starts at 6pm sharp .

• Rules explained at the game.

• Location: We're playing outdoor at Riverside Park @ 101st street in.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Play as a team. It take 2 to complete each pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

<a href="http://www.playsoccer2give.com/games/refund-request"></a> If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.name: Happy Hour: current events discussions & exciting group announcement

results.description:
PLEASE RSVP ON DHARMA DRINK MEETUP PAGE (www.dharmadrink.com - thank you!)

 

A great way to get Dharma connected in New York!

Meeting monthly at the Rubin during the summer - but special events will be announced like "Dharma Drink at the Beach or the Park" plus special group visits to see amazing teachers as the come to NYC over the summer!  Should be awesome!!!

 

For people interested in Buddhism or meditation or just leading a kinder life who are up for meeting like minded people.

Dharma Drink is now Self Service!

The table is always reserved in the same spot - just show up and see what happens  - just like if you were hanging out meeting other Buddhists randomly in Kathamandu or India. And don't take the RSVP too seriously - people are coming now who don't RSVP. The word is getting out....

Everyone is invited! Dharma Drink is all about building community amongst the Buddhist and like minded crowd in New York City. I was inspired to start Dharma Drink by hanging out with all of the great students of all of the different lamas in Kathmandu - Kagyu, Nyingma, Sakya, Gelug - totally Rimey (also Zen, Thai, Theravadan, yoga travelers, just about everyone!).  We all became great friends and learned from each other. We're there every Friday night - see you there.


Motivation:  To make the Rubin Museum Lounge on Friday night the Buddhist  hang-out spot in New York.

Who:  ALL ARE INVITED.  Feel free to spread the word.  The more, the merrier.

Time:  6-?pm
Date:  Every Friday - like clockwork
Place:  Rubin Museum Lounge, 17th Street and 7th Avenue
How to find us:  Look for a table with the small sign "Dharma Drink"                          + Lounge staff  will know where we are.

 

www.dharmadrink.com
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at a high-top table with little sign that says Dharma Drink opposite the Ganesh statue - the lounge staff will know where we are in case you get totally lost.
results.name: Dharma Drink: the hangout for Buddhists and like minded people

Coney Island was once the Hamptons and Jersey Shore for many Manhattanites in the 1800's.  Filled with swanky hotels it because America's Playground for many years.  Join a fun group of NYSN members and friends for this great Friday Night on the Boardwalk.  You will have a chance to learn about the history of Coney Island from the Dutch Settlers to it's downfall and now it's rise from the ashes!  Along the way you will get to socialize with others, check out the games and rides and food plus enjoy an amazing Fireworks display on the beach.

How does it work?  You can meet the group at The Playwright Irish Pub on 35th and 6th from 5:30-6pm or meet the group at Nathan's in Cony Island at 7:30pm.  We will contact you after you register to confirm.  At Nathan's everyone can grab a beer and a hot dog then we will take the history tour up Surf Avenue and down the Boardwalk.  At 9:30 there will be a huge fireworks display.  After the fireworks you can leave or hang with members of the group and play games or go on rides.

Can I come alone? Yes 95% of those attending will be coming on their own

What to expect: 20-30 fun a friendly people looking to enjoy a unique night out

What to wear: summer casual/business casual if coming from work. Comfortable shoes

When does it end? The fireworks are over at 10pm.  You can stay at the bar with the group or leave anytime you'd like.

Can I meet the group in Coney Island?  Yes but you will need to contact [masked] to make arrangements.

What to bring: Metrocard for 2 trips

What if it rains? We will do the tour only if the weather allows.  We will contact you on the day of to keep you posted.

Age Restriction 21+

PLEASE BRING EXACT CHANGE $15 There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going?  Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

You will be provided with a full checklist of key markers, traits, and things to be on the lookout for in deceptive people to guide you on this journey. results.description:
What day is today? Why, it's bring the pain Friday! It is once again time for us to ... Dodge. The. Ball.

If you don't know, now you know ...

If you've never played the game of dodgeball as a kid you must have grown up on Mars. But as a quick primer, it's a game in which players on two teams throw large balls at each other while avoiding being hit themselves. That's it. And no athletic skill is necessary!

If you haven't played the game in 20 years, here are the general rules we will be using with a few modifications: Dodgeball Rules

A $3.00 organization fee will be collected at this event, your host is in the running for hardest working person on meetup.

The important stuff ...

• This is a co-ed game so ladies don't be shy to sign up. And it doesn't matter if you have no athletic ability, you just have to be willing to have a little fun.

• Dress for physical activity! You'll be dodging and running so wear your sneaks, shorts and a t-shirt.

• Rain or similar un-favorable weather cancels the meetup. Not!

• Check the meetup site before leaving for last minute updates as well as my mobile phone number.

• Please DO NOT RSVP if you do not seriously plan to attend as space is limited. No flakes allowed! If you RSVP and I notice that you have a number of no shows or have a history of last minute cancellations, you will be removed.

• Sorry, no guests allowed for this one.
results.name: Urban Athletics: Dodgeball for Grownups (Co-ed)

results.description:
For beginners and experienced meditators.

Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Based on traditional Buddhist teachings, it has become an increasingly popular practice, as it generates both concentration and a deep understanding of the nature of our connection to ourselves and others.

This is a drop-in event, and pre-registration is not necessary. We're offering it on a donation basis, and request each participant to contribute between $10 - $20 to support this and other initiatives led by The Interdependence Project. 

Please visit http://theidproject.org/events/2015/06/05/metta-meditation-group for details. 

Please note that our space is not wheelchair accessible and can only be reached by climbing two steep flights of stairs!
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM) Group - Every Friday!

results.description:
A seminar on LightSail™ given by The Planetary Society. 

Join The Planetary Society's Outreach Coordinator for NYC to know more about LightSail™, a citizen-funded project by The Planetary Society, the world's largest non-profit space advocacy group!

We’re sending a small spacecraft into Earth orbit carrying large, reflective sails. We successfully completed a test flight in June 2015 that paved the way for a second, full-fledged solar sailing demonstration in 2016. These solar sails use the sun’s energy as a method of propulsion—flight by light. 

for more information on LightSail

™

 visit sail.planetary.org
results.name: Travel by Light: The Story of The Planetary Society's LightSail Spacecraft

Come join us at Ultimate Vapor Source NYC for an introduction to Loose leaf vaporizers, wax vaporizers and e-liquid - a healthier alternative to traditional smoking habits. We will discover the maintenance, safety and variety of uses as well as try out different products! This class is closed from the public and is meant to be a fun experience for small groups and individuals alike. Come and see what the hype is all about and enjoy a fun and entertaining class with our very special host, "Tony"

Every event comes with a free dry herb vaporizer of your own!

Book Now!

results.description:
Whether you’re getting ready for work in the morning, or going out for a night on the town, your makeup needs to leave a strong impression. Let us teach you all about today’s products and techniques, and then give you the skills to combine them into the perfect look. Each class features an intimate group setting for maximum fun and learning. Join our class, learn about makeup, and finish off the night with a sweet glass of wine; you deserve it! 

Date: Aug 7 - 6pm - 3hr

*Use promo code SUMMERFLING for 25% off*

Tickets at: https://goo.gl/o7dJnJ

*Exact number of tickets may vary, check ticket link for the most up to date information

results.description:
For our summer 2014 games, we shall be playing with a new format:

• 8 minutes/ 2 goals game. The games will be 2 hours long.

• Teams will be 7 a-side, (6 outfield players and a goalkeeper).

• Lime green colored pinnies (practice jerseys) will be provided for one of the teams to diffrentiate teams.

Please signup ASAP and may the force be with you :)

Disclaimer: By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.
results.name: Friday soccer under the sky!

results.description:
The Schomburg Center hosts a social networking event the first Friday evening of each month, rain or shine, from 6 pm to 10pm.


In honor of trailblazer Larry Levan, August First Friday: House Music edition at the Schomburg will jam all night long to house music! Levan was a pioneer of house music in New York City, best known for his decade-long residency at the popular New York City night club, Paradise Garage. With sets referred to by his cult following as “Saturday Mass,” Levan experimented with drum machines and synthesizers, ushering in an electronic, post-disco sound that jump started the house music movement. 

Suggested donations are welcome and sign up for a Schomburg membership is always encouraged. Enjoy signature drinks and extended viewing hours of their two new Exhibitions:

• Curators Choice: Black Life Matters, and

• The 75th Anniversary of the American Negro Theatre

The host for the Night will be Dhalimu from Dhali's Closet, and your deejays for the night will be DJ MASAI in the Langston Hughes Lobby and DJ Frankie Paradise in the courtyard.

#FirstFriday #Schomburg90 #LarryLevan

Our Meetup


We'll meet in the Langston Hughes lobby where the music will be playing. There will be a drink table with a HarlemGo Meetup sign to gather there.

Please find me (Daniel) at the HarlemGo drink table. I, as well as others, will be wearing a "GO" name tag (similar to the image above) on the front of my jacket/shirt, and name tags will be given out to identify other members. 

Many of the library and NYPL staff and executives attend the Schomburg Center's First Fridays events, as well as a wide variety of professionals from many backgrounds and industries. Definitely a good social & networking opportunity!

Post-First Fridays Drinks at Ginny's Supper Club

Afterwards, we'll head down to Ginny's Supper Club at Red Rooster
(www.ginnyssupperclub.com) to keep the good spirits going with a nightcap of drinks at the bar, socializing and dancing. Making a dinner reservation at Ginny's is strongly suggested for those that may want to grab a bite after the Schomburg event.

We'll arrive at Ginny's around 9:30pm and will end the meetup there officially at 11pm. If you can't make the Schomburg event, feel free to meetup with us there, and anyone is welcome to stay as long as they'd like.

Ginny's Supper Club is located on the downstairs level of Red Rooster
(www.redroosterharlem.com), 310 Lenox Avenue, between 125th & 126th Streets. 

As always, if you're running late, need further directions, or have any questions, please give Daniel a call/text to 774.275.3646.

Directions to The Schomburg Center:

Train: Take the #2 or #3 trains to 135th Street. The Schomburg entrance is between 135th & 136 streets, on Malcom X Blvd. (Lenox Avenue).
Bus: Catch either the M7 or M102 to 135th Street and Malcolm X Blvd.

About The Schomburg Center

The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture, a research unit of The New York Public Library, is generally recognized as one of the leading institutions of its kind in the world. For over 80 years the Center has collected, preserved, and provided access to materials documenting black life, and promoted the study and interpretation of the history and culture of people of African descent.
results.name: First Fridays @ The Schomburg Center & Ginny's (Red Rooster) After

results.description:
Join us for refreshments, live music, socializing, and the taping of Open Mic On Education, the show for K-12 educators.  Participation in the show is YOUR way of 'giving back' to the hard-working folks who run our schools.  Also, the show is a great way to be seen by thousands of decision-makers every month.  Finally, we're a fun group, and we'd like to hang out with you.

https://vimeo.com/112670089

Here are the details:

Date/Time: Friday. Aug 7. Refreshments at 6:00 pm, Show is taped from 6:45 - 8:00 pm.

Music: Live performance by Reni Lane http://renilane.com/#keezy

Location:  MNN El Barrio Firehouse Studio  175 E 104th Street, New York, NY


Directions: The studio is located on E. 104th Street between Lexington Ave and 3rd Ave.  Take the 6 Train to 103rd St Station and walk 1 block north.

Stay Informed:  Join our Meetup http://www.meetup.com/Open-Mic-On-Education/

We look forward to seeing you at the pre-show party and for taping the show.  Feel free to contact me by phone or email if you have any questions.

Alan Rudt
(917)[masked]
[masked]

Come join us for a night of art disscussion and drawing!

Any further questions feel free to message me.

results.description:
Metta, or Lovingkindness Meditation (LKM), is the practice of wishing oneself and others happiness, health, and ease. Studies indicate that practicing LKM positively impacts our emotions, our physical health, and our sense of connection. Our weekly Metta Meditation Group meets for practice and discussion every week with IDP's Executive Director, Kimberly Brown. 

This offering is open to both beginners and experienced meditators. Cushions and chairs will be provided. We request a $10-$20 donation to support our organization, though no one will be turned away for lack of funds.

Note we are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building. There is no elevator.


The Interdependence Project
302 Bowery 3rd Floor, Middle Buzzer
Between Houston and 1st Street
results.name: Lovingkindness Meditation Group

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/over40.html

We get it... You want to meet someone but don't feel like hanging out in bars amongst a bunch of 20 somethings or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our 40 & Over Singles Mixer is the perfect place for you!

THIS IS A MULTI-MEETUP GROUP EVENT. OVER 150 SINGLES WILL BE ATTENDING. THE RSVP LIST ON THIS PAGE IS ONLY A SMALL PORTION OF ACTUAL ATTENDEES.

TICKET PRICE: $20
Ticket price will be going up to $30 at the door so we recommend getting them ahead of time to save money and guarantee your spot.

(If coming in from a distance, it's okay if you arrive at 7:00 or after)

* Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!
* Suggested Age Range: 40s & 50s Plus Welcome To Attend
* Drink Specials!
* Free Light Passed Appetizers From 7 to 8
* Icebreakers With Chances To Win Prizes!
* Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling
* Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)
* Dress Code: Neat, Professional or Trendy (No sneakers, gym wear or t-shirts)

One of the great things about a Click event is that we do our best to gender balance our mixers.... Meaning that we keep the male/female ratio close and never let our parties have either WAY too many men or WAY too many women. As we get closer to the event date, we may shut down ticket sales for one gender to help keep the ratios balanced. Therefore we highly recommend getting your ticket/s as soon as possible to secure your spot.

group.name: ! Social Events For Educated, Sophisticated NYC Singles !

results.description:
We're excited to be hosting an interview prep meetup for Problem Solving Practice for Coders.

***  
Important: You need to RSVP through Problem Solving Practice for Coders' event page. An RSVP on this page, is not sufficient. 

Sign up at their Meetup page.

***


Description:

We'll be using Cracking the Coding Interview (6th edition) by Gayle Laakmann McDowell.  We will go over problems in the book as well as go over effective interviewing strategies.

This meetup runs every other Friday at this site.  We also have a meetup that runs every other Thursday at another site, giving our members a weekly dose of Algorithms and Interview Prep if they want.

This Friday's meetup will focus on Chapter 2, "Linked Lists".

We will be posting our calendar for the year shortly.
results.how_to_find_us: Entrance on 41st between Park and Madison
results.name: Problem Solving Practice For Coders

results.description:
Hola amigos y amigas:


Join our Culture, Grammar & Conversation Workshops to improve your speaking and listening skills in Spanish in a fun and natural way. During the workshops an experienced instructor will help you develop the vocabulary and grammar structures necessary to be able to converse on various subjects of interest. We have two levels:

BEGINNERS & LOWER INTERMEDIATES

The workshops are very interactive, fun and stimulating. They are conducted by an experienced Spanish instructor who will correct mistakes, explain grammar and usage -whenever necessary- and highlight essential vocabulary for effective communication in Spanish.

COST: Just $15 per person, includes: workshop, printouts (if needed), pencil, fun!

IMPORTANT: Clicking "YES" without payment does not reserve a spot - ONLY ADVANCE PAYMENT DOES - This goes for ALL our events

--------------------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL: LOWER INTERMEDIATES (B1*)

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Jorge Gallegos

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

-----------------------------------------------------------------

LEVEL:  MIDDLE BEGINNERS and UP *

TIME: From 6:30pm to 8:00pm

TEACHER: Maria Angelica Garcia

****CLICK HERE TO PAY & REGISTER****

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

(*) NOT SURE ABOUT YOUR LEVEL OF SPANISH? Visit HERE for some guidance.

Need to confirm your payment went through? Read ---> HERE

Previous Spanish Conversation Workshops for small groups were a big success! Read comments ---> HERE

**************************************

DETAILS
Only up to 10 participants per group. We'll have two groups running at the same time.

Duration: 1 hour and 30 minutes per workshop

Jorge Gallegos and Maria Angelica Garcia from Easy Espanol (www.easyespanol.org) will be your language coaches. Jorge is a skilled Spanish language instructor with over fourteen years of experience teaching Spanish as a second language. Maria Angelica is a dynamic instructor from Venezuela with a good sense of humor and a deep knowledge about contemporary cultural issues in South America and the rest of the Spanish speaking world.

Please be aware that late tolerance is 15 minutes (you can't join a workshop if you are over 15 minutes late after 6:30pm).

ABOUT RSVP: Keep in mind that for all our paid events, RSVP does not guarantee a spot, only advance payment does

WHERE TO FIND US

The workshops will be held at 555 8th Avenue, Suite 110 (between 37th & 38th)

See where we are in a map---> HERE

CANCELLATIONS: You can cancel and get a full refund anytime up to 48 hours before your workshop start time. Read more HERE

Nos vemos!

Jorge

results.description:
We get it... You want to meet someone special but don't feel like hanging out in bars amongst a bunch of recent college grads or wasting time weeding through online dating profiles. You've been there, done that and want to find your mature match who is tired of all the childish games and ready for something real. Well... our Singles Mixer is the perfect place for you!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$20 for our members - Prepay here https://40sclickmixer.eventbrite.com

$30 at the door if available

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

So what's a Click Mixer? Ever find yourself looking across the bar and saying, “He’s cute, I wonder if he’s single” or “She seems nice, but maybe she has a boyfriend". Well, wonder no more! Everyone at a Click Mixer is single and looking to meet someone. At every Click Mixer we set up fun ice breakers to get the party going (during which you can win prizes!) You can participate or just relax and mingle at your own pace.

Over 150 Single Professionals Attending!

Drink Specials!

Win Prizes!

Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling

Typically 70% of Attendees Come Alone (30% bring friends)

Suggested Age Range: late 30's to 50's

The Best Way To Meet Quality Singles in NYC

results.description:
Click Here To Sign Up Online

                                                 From 6:30pm-10:00pm

                     **An RSVP on meetup.com will not reserve your spot**

Tired of waiting on long lines or showing up 3 hours early to a gym just to try and get a spot. Well wait no more!

With Big City you also get to play on the same team as your friends when you show up.

Sign-Up in advance to participate in Big City Volleyball's weekly Open Play Friday evenings from 7:00pm – 10:00pm at The High School For Environmental Studies (444 West 56th Street betw. 9th & 10th Avenue), one of our premier gyms with two courts, conveniently located just a few blocks from Columbus Circle.

Who Can Participate:
Intermediate to Advanced players only! Players must be able to handle a free ball, pass accurately, serve consistently and play bump-set-spike vball rather than just retuning the ball to the other side of the court. (In Big City that's Divisions 3, 4 & 5). If you cannot do the above, you will be asked to leave. You don't have to currently play in the league to participate.

Where:
High School For Environmental Studies (444 West 56th Street - between 9th & 10th Avenue)

When:
Friday evenings Sept Thru June.

Times:
6:30pm - 10:00pm
  How Much:
$15 per session On-line in advance.


(ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS)
Only players who register on-line will be guaranteed a spot.
Players who pay at the door will not be given a spot to play until all on-line registered players have been checked in and then only if space permits.
Players who pay in advance will lose their spot if they arrive after check-in is complete.
Players can register in advance as many people as they like per session.
Players can Register in advance for as many sessions as they like.
*Must be 21 years old to participate.
*Only 48 spots per session.
(ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS)

How It Works
Each court will have up to three teams of 8 players. games will be to 21 points rally scoring. Players will sub in on dead balls. If a team wins two games in a row they must sit one game.

Big City prides itself on friendly competition. Please play fair and maintain respectable behavior towards your teammates and opponents. Call your own violations! (Nets, Sets and Out Balls). If you are rude in any manner or raise your voice you will be asked to leave and not allowed to participate again.
                                      ***Click Here Sign-Up On-Line In Advance***
results.name: Big City Volleyball Co-Ed Friday Open Play!!!

results.description:
This free workshop introduces the The Art of Living Foundation's seminal programs.  Over 40 million people worldwide have benefited from the Foundation's programs which teach simple yet powerful breathing and meditative techniques for reducing stress, anxiety, and fear, while increasing the potential for clarity, joy, and inner peace.

In the workshop we explore the connection between breath and meditation and state of mind.  Participants will experience the breath as a fundamental tool to unlocking a happier, more relaxed state of being with higher levels of awareness, focus and clarity.  We will experience the yoga of breath and end with a guided meditation.

Participants will also learn more about the additional course offerings at Art of Living Foundation which will allow them to develop a personal home practice. 

When:Friday 6:30pm-7:45pm

**Please arrive early for seating and registration

Where: 286 5th Ave  5th Floor (between 30th and 31st St) NY 10001
results.why: I Meditate NY is a movement empowering New Yorkers to do more things they love by recharging through meditation, a practical way to refresh every day, invented thousands of years ago. Reinvented in 2011. Our mission is to recharge New York!

results.description:
Please join a fun group of people who are interested in a diverse mix of strategy, card, and party games.  We play games such as Ticket to Ride, Avalon, Hanabi, Pandemic, Tzolk'in and many others. 

We encourage you to bring your own games; there are always people looking to learn something new, as well as find a new favorite board game.

Mass Transit to this location is available by taking the Q54 bus or by the E-F-M-R train stop at 71st-Continental Ave then to the Q23 bus. 

You can purchase drinks, foods, and snacks, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks.  We want this restaurant to enjoy our presence! 

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us.  Newcomers are always welcome!

If you want to join our board game facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buy/sell games or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:


https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

results.description:
If you want to jump start your writing or you need a break from the novel you're working on, come join us. Just bring your own writing devices, I will provide prompts (if you have something you're working on you can work on that instead) and we'll write for 10 minutes straight. This is full- out, non-stop writing. Then we share- only if you want to- and do it again. We usually do this 2 times a meeting. It's a great way to get some words on the page. No prior reading or experience required to attend. You can leave early as we usually do this every half hour. Gotham Writer's Workshop charges $25 for this. Cost of this meetup? Free.

Jessica

<a>[masked]</a>
results.name: Just Write!

results.description:
Foam, a community of Architects, will be leading a workshop about urban initiatives and community organization using blockchain technology at the Civic Art Lab in Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn.


We will begin by explaining how Foam began while providing participants with an introductory presentation to blockchain technology — the decentralized public ledger at the heart of Bitcoin and related cryptocurrency projects. There will also be a demonstration of BoardRoom, a platform for community organization and decision-making built on the blockchain. Finally, there will be a presentation on the potential impact of blockchain technology on local communities, focusing specifically on Fulton Mall in Downtown Brooklyn.

The workshop portion of the event will be a think tank session for participants who will brainstorm conceptual implementations of blockchain technology in creative and open ways to share skills, ideas and urban projects. The focus here will be to have participants thinking of new parallel economic models. The workshop will take advantage of a combination of diverse perspectives and skill sets in order to discover real world applications of the blockchain that engage the community and foster social change.

We will also demonstrate how groups can use the blockchain to organize themselves and manage their activities, such as crowd-fund and govern the use of a shared space. We will discuss how communities could distribute decision making capabilities and power amongst the group fluidly. In this workshop we will explore how sustainable technology can be built alongside communities who manage and evolve them democratically.


About Civic Art Lab


This event is part of the Civic Art Lab, a community storefront in Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn in collaboration with the Bridge Street Development Corporation’s Pop-up Program. This environmental, arts, and educational initiative calls on neighbors to co-produce creative and open ways to share skills and showcase recent cultural and environmental initiatives happening locally in order to amplify the diverse voices and encourage future community engagement.

Civic Art Lab is a project of the GREENSPACENYC Collaborative.
results.name: FOAM presents Blockchain Community Architecture Workshop

results.description:
Join us for a discussion based on the book Rosicrucian Order AMORC, Questions and Answers by Christian Bernard.

You can download the free e-book here!

About the Book

This book provides answers to commonly asked questions regarding the Rosicrucian tradition and the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC.

Some of the topics to be covered include:

What is AMORC? Rosicrucian History, Membership in AMORC, AMORC as a Community, AMORC and Other Groups, Rosicrucian Teachings, Viewpoints Regarding Controversial Topics, Spirituality and Science, Religious Matters, Political Matters, Health Matters, Financial Matters, Definitions, Reincarnation and Karma, Eras and Cycles, AMORC and the 21st Century

All are Welcome!
results.name: Circle of Spiritual Inquiry - Rosicrucian Order, AMORC: Questions & Answers

results.description:
The Morgan Library and Museum Free Friday 7-9pm

Featuring:

Alice: 150 Years of Wonderland

This exhibition traces the making and history of Lewis Carroll's Alice in Wonderland through the author's personal items, sketch books, diaries and photos. The original hand illustrated manuscript Alice's Adventures Under Ground, which Carroll gave as a Christmas present to Alice Liddel in 1864, is featured along with the original iconic sketches by John Tenniel. Come learn about the Liddel Sisters, how they inspired Carroll as well as the creation and publishing history of this classic book.

Also on view:
Life Lines Portrait Drawings from Durer to Picasso
Hidden Likeness: Photographer Emmet Gowin
A Certain Slant of Light: Spencer Finch at the Morgan

Join us afterward for a snack or drink in Murray Hill.
results.how_to_find_us: Meet in front of the museum at 645. Look for me or John. Our photos are to the left under Organizers. You can also text me at 9172028334.
results.name: Morgan Library & Museum Free Fridays featuring aLicE: 150 yEaRs of wOnDErlaNd

results.description:
Friday Japanese/English Language Exchange

Join us for 2 hours every “Friday Japanese / English Language Exchange!" In this event, you will get to learn about English and Japanese as well as socialize with other members! If you would like to practice and learn more English and Japanese, then this is your event!

毎週金曜日２時間実施される金曜日、英語日本語語学交流会にぜひお越し下さい！イベントでは日本語と英語を学ぶことはもちろんのこと、他のメンバーさんとの交流も楽しんで頂けます。

 

<strong style="font-size : medium">Details:

Lessons: Varying levels of Japanese and English lessons are given at multiple stations, focusing on aspects such as grammar, listening, and conversation.

Language Exchange: After the lessons, we have a free exchange for people in both languages.

詳細:

レッスン：文法、リッスニング、会話などに焦点をおいた日本語、英語のそれぞれのレベルに合わせたレッスンが受講できます。

語学交流会： レッスン後、両語学による自由な交流会をになります。

Time:

Every Friday, from 6:45pm to 8:45pm

Entrance fee: $5.00

 

<strong style="font-size : medium">Location:

Chelsea Studios

An evening of connections & culture over cocktails
Come Early To Network | Stay Late To Party
Free Before 7:00pm with RSVP | $10.00 after 7:00pm

You must RSVP by EOD on Thursday August 6th to be added to the guestlist

Join us on Friday August 7th for an evening of connections and culture over cocktails at NYC's newest and largest Afro-Caribbean monthly mixer for African and international professionals in the the city.

AfropolitanNYC is a monthly mixer where diaspora professionals in the city can connect, unwind and enjoy the best selection of Afro-Caribbean music by A-list Afrobeats and international icon DJs. The Afropolitan movement started in Washington DC in July 2013, and is now DC's largest multi-Cultural professional mixer, attracting close to 800 young professionals every month to connect, exchange ideas and socialize.

Space is limited and we are anticipating a full house so please RSVP as soon as possible.

Join me and hundreds of other professionals, and get ready for a unique and exciting Afropolitan experience.


DJs: DJ Kweks | DJ Spynfo
Music: Afrobeats | Dancehall Reggae | Soca | Hiphop | Pop | Latin

results.description:
Make Me One with Everything: Buddhist Meditations to Awaken From the Illusion of Separation

Talk & Book signing

Based on Tibetan Buddhism’s core insights into the inherent essence of who we are, the teachings of shared spirituality in Make Me One with Everything offer meditators a better way to live in every moment of their lives.


Lama Surya Das may examine such topics as:

• How to meditate with the Dalai Lama

• Co-meditation and sharing spirituality with our partners

• Why inter-meditating helps us in this fractured, discordant digital era

• Heart/mind training methods such as Lojong and Tonglen

• Inter-meditation practices to help dissolve conflict in relationships

• Healing inter-meditations to help us work with an illness

Lama Surya Das is one of the foremost Western Buddhist meditation teachers and scholars. The Dalai Lama affectionately calls him “the American Lama”. He is an authorized lama in the Tibetan Buddhist order, a leading spokesperson for Buddhism and contemporary spirituality, a translator, poet, meditation master, chant master, and spiritual activist. In 1991 he established the Dzogchen Center and Dzogchen Retreats (www.dzogchen.org). In 1993, with the Dalai Lama, he founded the Western Buddhist Teachers Network and regularly organizes its International Buddhist Teachers’ Conferences.

Today, Lama Surya Das teaches and lectures around the world, conducting dozens of meditation retreats and workshops each year and is a regular contributor at The Huffington Post. His blog, Ask The Lama, can be found at http://askthelama.com. His lecture and retreat schedule are listed at www.surya.org. He can also be followed on Facebook (Lama Surya Das) and Twitter (@LamaSuryaDas). Lama Surya Das resides in Concord, Massachusetts. 

In order to RSVP, you will need to register through the New York Open Center website not the Meetup.com's website or contact the New York Open Center Registration Department,(212)[masked] (ext 2) or [masked]


Event FREE

A small band of Disciples have banded together to protect their neighborhood and chart their own destinies in the Roxbury neighborhood of Boston, Massachusettes, in the wake of the dispersal of the Avatar Storm. Nodes, Sancta and Libraries lie unclaimed. It is only a matter of time before the Technocracy returns in force.  What destiny will your band of wizards claim?

This will be a beginner's chronicle for Mage: The Ascension, using the newly released backer's PDF for Mage: The Ascension 20th Anniversary Edition (and print copy which should be released shortly.) This is meant to be friendly to newcomers to Mage: The Ascension, the classic White Wolf game of urban fantasy and metaphysics. results.description: I am very grateful that Brianne will facilitate the discuss this time. She can bring a lot of her new wisdom. Life can be very challenging to each one of us. There are so many things to do and so many people to interact with. Making the "right" choice can be a big challenge. Finding the balance in life can be difficult. And, yet, the Nature has a way of taking care of itself. If we can learn from the Nature we can live a life just like the Nature, in total force and vigor when we need to and in total peace when we want to. Does this make sense to you? Please come with an open mind, ready to share and learn from each other. The spiritual path can be full of ups and downs. We need the support of each other and grow together. Hope to see you. Craig

results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

results.description:
Brazilian Music Foundation is organizing the First International Choro Festival in the City of New York, from August 7 to 12.  The Foundation goal is to bring together local musicians and fellow musicians from Brazil to represent traditional Choro and authorial songs at the festival.


The festival will be held at different dates and venues. All proceeds will go to Brazilian Music Foundation (BMF.ORG), a non-profit organization promoting Brazilian culture through music via educational performance programs.

Open Benefit Concert 


August 7 at 7:30 PM - $25

The opening concert will have BMF Choro Collective (formed by the BMFSOM teachers and special guests) followed by the Group Choro das 3 playing traditional Choro and enlightening us with some of its history. This is a great opportunity for those who are not familiar with Choro to learn about this fantastic Brazilian style of music.

For schedule information or to by your ticket online, check http://bmf-usa.org/choro-festival-2/

What is CHORO?

From Wikipedia: “Choro ("cry" or "lament"), popularly called chorinho ("little cry" or "little lament"), is an instrumental Brazilian popular music genre which originated in 19th century Rio de Janeiro. Despite its name, the music often has a fast and happy rhythm. It is characterized by virtuosity, improvisation and subtle modulations, and is full of syncopation and counterpoint. Choro is considered the first characteristically Brazilian genre of urban popular music. The serenaders who play choros are known as chorões.”


<a href="http://bmf-usa.org/choro-festival-2/"></a>
results.name: First International Choro Festival

results.description:
The latest addition to the Marvel Movie Universe: The Fantastic Four Reboot.

Movie time will be 7:30PM.

Registered members can pay via credit card or check. Others can pay for the tickets via money order, or by cash at our offices in person. No refunds once the group purchase of the tickets is made! 

Because we're watching on opening weekend there will be a line inside the multiplex in front of the theater. Trying to meet before going in could lead to awful seats for everyone because some people will be rushing from work and might be a little late. Instead, we all get our tickets before hand and then meet up afterwards to discuss the movie (and this way everyone gets to watch the movie in their favorite seats).


While we are not going to wait until the bitter end for every RSVP to show up, and therefore lose all the good seats, we are going to be there 45 minutes ahead of time with a MG Meetup sign. We will be going up to the theater line once it opens. If you come up a little later to the theater line and want to sit with us in the middle section of the middle set of seats don't cut the line, just let us know when you get upstairs and we'll hold the seat for you (because you are already there, just further back in the line). But if you prefer another spot, that's ok too. Just pick your own seat. If you are kept late and work and get there 5 minutes after the trailers begin, you don't have to worry about the Group yelling at you because we held a seat for 30 minutes and you couldn't find us. (This is our first month doing this so we are working to make it as stress free as possible for everyone involved and it is a work in progress).

The total member discount price is $11. Remember, you are NOT required to use the member discount to join us. If you have a better discount or rewards plan feel free to use it and come join us anyway!!

Further details are provided to the RSVP list as the movie approaches.

Read the Group Discount instructions here:


http://www.meetup.com/New-York-Moviegoers-Meetup/boards/thread/49091540
results.name: Fantastic Four Movie $11 Group Special Tickets

Every Friday we have a causal gathering of open minded souls, who
want to learn from Bhagavad Gita, the Vedic wisdom, and incorporate
in to their life. We will be learning various fascinating topics
like karma and reincarnation, Who am I, What is the real purpose
of life? Who god is? material life, Consciousness, etc.

Mantra meditation is the process of bhakti yoga consisting of
hearing and chanting the names of the lord on the beads, followed by
melodious music to invoke lord's mercy. This practice has a powerful
heart opening effect, which can be best understood through direct
experience. Come, relax in a warm and friendly atmosphere. Listen/observe
or just chant with us or sing your heart out! Questions, personal
realization, and discussion about the application of spiritual
practice are welcome.

Free Home made vegetarian/vegan dinner
(prasadam) served.

Admission to each meetup is free.
Donations for meetups expenses are welcome.

results.description:
Join us @ Rio Bravo for Great Mexican cuisine!!!

At Rio Bravo Tacos and Tequila in Larchmont, formerly The Globe, there's a build-your-own margarita menu and customizable table-side guacamole, in addition to a long menu of Mexican-American standbys like tacos, carnitas and enchiladas.

A good fit for both ladies night and family outings, Rio Bravo's menu is affordable (most entrees cost between $8 and $16) and offers a mix-and-match option so indecisive eaters can choose one item from each section and sample everything.

The space is festive and saturated with color (each wall painted is a different one), and there are Dia de los Muertos statues set in lit alcoves. The sunny street-facing dining room connects to the bar in the back, where there are 55 varieties of tequilas and fun margarita combinations (available in pitchers), like the flaming and salty Torero.

Keep an eye on the restaurant's Facebook page for happy hour and weekday specials, such as Taco Tuesday, Karaoke Thursday and Mariachi Sunday.

results.description:
Open level class. Any level student can practice, taking the postures to a more challenging experience. Beginners are welcome, postures can always be modified to suit the individual. As always, listen to your body, take the postures to were it feels right for you and have fun! This class builds upon Basic  yoga postures, continuing our growth. Students always have the option to take this class where they desire... from a basic level and build foundation or to more challenging postures and flow techniques. It all depends on the individual and what their body needs ! Its an open field  for exploration and discovery.

 Breathing techniques focused upon during practice to connect the body and mind with the breath. Power Yoga builds muscle strength from the core outward, tones the body, creates endurance and stamina. Great for over all health. Breathing techniques calm the mind and ground the self.

There is a 15 minute optional deep relaxation and  guided meditation after class going deeper into chakra balancing.

results.description:
If you have never before experienced this wonderful place, you don't want to miss a really perfect summer event.  What a combination:  music from a 20 piece orchestra; a moon rising on Long Island Sound; a long boardwalk for a stroll by the harbor; fireworks, dancing and all kinds of people celebrating on a Friday night.

This coming Friday, August 7, from 7:30 to 10:30, is the last night to enjoy the great music of Milt Gerver's Big Band Orchestra.  At 9:15 is a spectacular display of fireworks and then back to more music and dancing.  Please come and join us at one of the picnic tables.  Look for the table with a green checkered table cloth and a couple of balloons to help you locate the Greenwich Club for singles group.  A couple of us will arrive at 6 PM to get the table, so you can arrive any time after that.  Everyone is encouraged to bring some snack to share, plus your own beverage, plate, and chair.  Parking in the main lot is $5.00, but for seniors it is $1.00.  If you park in the smaller lot to the right as you enter, you will have to climb down some very steep stairs, carrying all your stuff.

We expect a large crowd for this event.

• Please make sure to bring your helmet, you are responsible for your own safety.

results.description:
Enjoy Shakespeare for free, set in the (still somewhat gritty) Lower East Side!

"Macbeth (full title The Tragedy of Macbeth) is a tragedy written by William Shakespeare, and is considered one of his darkest and most powerful works. Set in Scotland, the play illustrates the damaging physical and psychological effects of political ambition on those who seek power for its own sake." --Wikipedia


Sleep No More--which we're attending a few days later--is a reinterpretation of this classic play, so this event should serve as a great (re-)introduction to the story, before we experience it without words or continuity.


Meet me in the parking lot at 7:45pm.  Afterwards, we can head to a nearby bar or restaurant for drinks or dinner, if desired.


shakespeareintheparkinglot.com

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every week we go to someone's apt, park, or bar.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. -On serves only one REDO will be granted per player per game on first serve. (Can hit any obstacle (except lighting) and ball cannot be going out of bounds on sides) After a successful serve(s), no redos! (Beneficial to players waiting to sub in)

- NO REDOS on ceiling obstacles only on WIRE (less arguing, will speed up games)

-If each team fouls they both will cancel each other and a redo will be played immediately 

-No Net touches top or bottom (For Safety of all players)
