results.description:
This month's Drink N' Draw is sponsored by Queens Brewery! 

Want to get out of the house or studio and refresh your artistic skills? Looking to meet local creatives, network and exchange ideas? Come to Astoria Drink N Draw! 


Location? Q.E.D. A Place To Show And Tell [masked]rd Avenue Astoria, NY 11105)

When? First Friday of every month, 9PM! 

On the first Friday of every month, Q.E.D. hosts a three-hour social drawing event with focus on figure drawing from a live model. 


No need to be a pro, stick figures and hand-turkey’s welcome! Bring your friends or enjoy an evening of creative exploration and meeting local artists. Each Friday will have a unique theme, new models, and plenty to drink!

Bring your own materials. Some materials will be available for purchase.

Pre-purchasing tickets will NOT include a free drink this week, however, there will be...

$3 160z Queens Lager by Queens Brewery all night!

                                  **Buy Tickets Here**

results.description:
Starting this Friday, March 6th, Sizzling Salsa will implement a reduction in prices for the dance socials on Fridays. Under this new cover charge, singles will pay $12.00. Also, couples will pay $20.00. With the implementation of this new flat fee, singles will save $3.00. In addition, couples will save $5.00.


Although we are offering this comprehensive package for our weekly parties, you'll still pay nothing for food, drinks, water etc. Moreover, you'll continue enjoying the great selection of Latin music, and the quality of our state-of-the-art PA and DJ system, which produces pristine sound. 


The dance socials start at 9:00 pm.

RAVI BINDRA

Desi Fridays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty.

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Friday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. ***This is the same location- just out the back doors under the lights! Beautiful turf field provides for some beautiful soccer.  Full field - back up to 22 players!!

Join Friday nights intermediate/advanced players for some seriously fun, face-paced soccer under the lights at Hofstra University.   These games will be played on beautiful turf fields and are indoor/outdoor, depending on the season.  

Summer= Outside

Fall/Winter= Indoor

These games start promptly at 10:30 pm, please be on time or your spot may be given away to the walk-ons that do show up. 

The fee for this game is $15.00 which covers the cost of the field which you must pay even if you no show.  The field is expensive and the Club goes out of pocket for you if you do not show up! 

RSVP Rules apply!  Update cut off is 4:00 pm Friday.

results.description:
**MOVING THIS SHOOT TO FOLLOWING WEEKEND TO GET MORE RSVPS**

Calling all Pixels to capture beautiful colors of sunrise over Manhattan from NJ.

I'll post the sunrise timings as we get closer to the event date. Roughly it should be around 5:00 AM

What to carry?

• Bring your sturdy Tripod.

• Wide Angle Lens (16 mm to anywhere near 24 mm)

• Remote Trigger/ Cable Release for long exposures.


• If you would like to bring in ND filters, they might help in reducing the light as the sun rises with more brightness. Using ND filters will reduce light and make the water smooth and smoky.


This is what you expect from the shoot:


We will meet in the smaller parking lot of Liberty State Park on Freedom Way (approx 1.2 miles from the address point)

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

results.description:
Let's cycle Summer Streets, the annual celebration of New York City’s most valuable public space — our streets. If you're not familiar with Mayor Bloomberg's ongoing program, for three Saturdays each Summer nearly seven miles of NYC’s streets are cleared of automobile traffic and opened for people to play, walk, bike, and breathe.

The route stretches from the Brooklyn Bridge up to 72nd Street and into Central Park, running along Park Avenue and numerous connecting streets. This event is part bike tour, part walking tour, part block party — a great time for exercise, people watching, or just enjoying the Summer morning. There will be many free activities and vendors along the route for us to stop and explore, including a rock climbing wall at Spring Street, zip lining at Foley Square, bike helmet giveaways at 51st Street, and much, much more.

The Plan

Since I broke my foot, I won't be be able to 'lead' this meetup however I encourage everyone to connect with others on the meetup page. This is a fun event enjoyed best as a group and doesn't really require any 'leader'.


Required Equipment:

Bike helmet and lock, sunscreen/sunglasses, water, and snacks. I also recommend you make sure your bike is in good working order before the meetup and a patch repair kit, air pump, and spare inner tube.

Meetup Disclaimer: You agree when you sign up that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. Your attendance to an event signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver. The complete liability waiver can be found on the PAGES section of this meetup site.
results.name: NYC Summer Streets! Biking through Manhattan

results.description:
When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

 

Art of Living Secaucus Center

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916


2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

venue.name: Brooklyn, Atlantic terminal

results.description:
WHAT: Let's get together and have spiritual journey into the mountainside, with imperial garden design. We'll visit John p. Humes garden, with the transcendent feeling of a deep, remote mountain hamlet.
It was created in accordance with Zen precepts and aesthetics. Another word, Japanese culture of stone lamps, bonsai plants and tea house (where we will have Japanese tea ceremony) give this garden a taste of East Asia in the heart of Long island.
Then we'll walk to to Bailey Arboretum - first private garden museums, which contain large selection of
redwood trees. It was founded by Frank Bailey, who was a self-taught horticulturalist and botanist.
And, finally we'll visit Planting field - Tudor Revival residence of the Coe family, we'll see stunning craftsmanship and impressive collections of furnishings and decorative arts as well as 400 acres of rolling lawns, gardens, woodlands, and nature walks. The Camellia Greenhouse displays the largest collection of camellias in the northeast, and the Main Greenhouse has extensive collections of hibiscus, orchids, succulents,
The address of Planting field: 1395 Planting Fields Road Oyster Bay, NY 11771
WHEN & WHERE:
Meeting at 8:15 AM on Sunday, August 8 at Long Island Rail Road Atlantic Station tickets booth.
The Atlantic Avenue Terminal is located across the street from the Williamsburg Savings Bank, the tallest building in Brooklyn which has a large clock on each side of its tower. You can take B, Q trains to Atlantic station or N, 2, 3, 4, 5 trains to Pacific station and walk toward LIRR ticket booth. I'll be waiting for you right there.
CONTACT: My phone:[masked]
COST: $18 for LIRR ticket, $10 Japanese garden, cab $8 , Bailey Arboretum is free, Planting field - $8.
TRANSPORT: We will take Long Island Rail Road Oyster bay branch to Locust valley station. The departure of the train from Brooklyn ( Atlantic terminal) at 8:22A.M, Manhattan (Penn station) at 8:25AM, and Queens (Jamaica station) at 8:52A.M. We’ll arrive to Locust Valley station at 9:35A.M.
Please, wear the proper shoes and attire for a hike in the woods. (No high heels etc.) Please, bring water and bug repellent. Also, somewhere along the way, we'll have a picnic, so bring snacks or light picnic food.
Planting field mansion, Bailey arboretum and Humes Japanese garden are Americas premier collection of historic estates. So let's enjoy their grace and elegance.
results.name: Tea ceremony at Humes Japanese garden, Bailey arboretum, Planting field gardens

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Founded in 1982 as the world’s first food
rescue organization, City Harvest is dedicated to helping feed the more than 1.4 million New Yorkers facing hunger.  City Harvest will collect 50 million pounds of excess food from restaurants, grocers, bakeries, manufacturers, and farms, and deliver it free of charge to more than 500 community food programs across the city this year.  In addition to helping meet the immediate need for food, City Harvest takes a long-term approach to fighting hunger by partnering with residents, local organizations and businesses through Healthy Neighborhoods programs which increase the availability of affordable fruits and vegetables in low-income communities and provide the nutrition education and resources to maintain a wholesome, food-secure diet.

The Mobile Markets take place outdoors, rain or shine. We stress that it's important to wear comfortable, weather appropriate clothes. As this is a very hands-on activity and there is no secure place to leave your property, it is recommended that you travel light, i.e., personal belongings should be left at home/office or a messenger bag/backpack should be used.


We provide an outlet for lower income individual and families to receive healthy food. This is a great opportunity to see how a major non-for-profit organization reaches a major population that seeks its help. This is also perfect for Spanish speakers, I am familiar with this community and have done a lot of work with Green Bronx in the same area. It is a wonderful community!  



Time: 8:30 am to 12:00 pm (noon)

Place: 595 Trinity Avenue, Bronx, NY 10455

Commute: 2 Train to 149th

Need especially: Spanish Speakers - Please apply


Must be on time

Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation:

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.name: 7v7 Easy Saturday Soccer August 8, 2015

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Saturday Morning Outdoor Yoga

This year's sessions will make way for students to further their practice incorporating the healing practice of Ayurveda. Ayurveda is the science of self healing. Students will discover their Dosha, and how to favorably balance this constitution. Postures, breath work, food, herbs, oils, energy cycles will be introduced that accompany each individuals Dosha. The teachings will guide students to better health, and harmony.

Classes will be held at 9am Saturday mornings.

First sessions schedule : JUNE 6, 13, 20.

Second session schedule : JULY 18, 25, and AUGUST 1, 8.

Fee is $20 per session.

RSVP IS NECESSARY FOR EACH SESSION.

Your spot will only be confirmed upon receipt of full payment and full payment is required up front.

Payment is acceptable via cash or check only. Checks can be mailed to:
Yoga and Melody
26 Rose Lane
Staten Island, N.Y. 10312

* Cash payments can be submitted during normal business hours of our regular weekly classes at church.
7 class cards will not be accepted for these classes.

results.description:
In this workshop, I will be teaching very basic principles of steaming. The class will mainly focus on the actual bending so I do not plan to be long winded. I will provide the minimal amount of info so everyone can do the fun part. 

 We will learn how to bend two types of domestic hardwood (two of the following: walnut, oak, cherry, ash, hickory or juniper). Everyone will keep all their bends along with instructions on how to finish the wood on their own time. 

Again, this class will only focus on the the bending, the prep work before and the finishing afterwards will not be the focus of this short class. The class size will be very small to provide hands-on one on one instruction and help.

Date: Aug 8 - 9am - 2hr

*Use promo code SUMMERFLING for 25% off*

Tickets at: https://goo.gl/pQqRnt

*Exact number of participants may vary, check ticket link for the most up to date information

results.description:
**INDOOR, FUTSAL OR SNEAKERS**  

                               NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS!

         NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES 

                                      @ RIVERSIDE Park!

                             See our page on Facebook!:

                        ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQxq4zYJDFg

DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

We'll play 3 simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check your email or our meetup message board on friday night or before 12.00pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

Riverside Park at West 107 & 108 Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to a local bar for brunch and a Pint or Two.

                                        Lion’s Head Tavern


                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

In this workshop, I will be teaching very basic principles of steaming. The class will mainly focus on the actual bending so I do not plan to be long winded. I will provide the minimal amount of info so everyone can do the fun part. 

 We will learn how to bend two types of domestic hardwood (two of the following: walnut, oak, cherry, ash, hickory or juniper). Everyone will keep all their bends along with instructions on how to finish the wood on their own time. 

Again, this class will only focus on the the bending, the prep work before and the finishing afterwards will not be the focus of this short class. The class size will be very small to provide hands-on one on one instruction and help.

Michelle Timek Yoga's FREE WATERFRONT YOGA is back for our 5th season!

We're so excited! To help make this season extra special, we we'll have other wellness giveaways and goodies in addition to our super fun, energetic, scenic, sunshiney Flow yoga class. Hooray!

Proudly sponsored by Michelle Timek Yoga + Jersey City


5th Season : Spring / Summer 2015, from May-September

WHERE : J. Owen Grundy Park (next to Hyatt, in Exchange Place, Jersey City)
DATES : 2nd Saturday each month from May-September
(5/09, 6/13, 7/11, 8/08, 9/12)
TIME : 9:00-10:15 am
WHO : everyone of all ages and experience!
BRING : yourself, your mat, water, towel, sunglasses, sunblock and friends
WEAR : anything comfortable you can move easily in

Please note, due to high volume of participation (yea!) space is open to a first come, first serve availability. Be sure to get there early to get your favorite spot on the pier!

P.S. If the weather looks questionable, check our facebook or twitter the morning of with possible reschedule dates or cancellations. We've been fortunate to have only one class cancellation in four years time due to weather!

For more details, visit us at www.michelletimekyoga.com

results.description:
WALK TALK YOGA


PRENATAL WALKING & YOGA GROUP IN BROOKLYN, PROSPECT PARK

Join prenatal yoga instructor Sofia and birth doula Kyra for a weekly walk through Prospect Park with a thirty minutes prenatal yoga class at the end of the walk.

The walking moms at 9AM at the entrance of the Brooklyn Public Library. We will start our walk at 9:15AM, which will take around 45 minutes, followed by a 30 minute prenatal yoga session.

This is a great way to start the day, bring new mommies together, stay fit and most importantly prepare for the special moment - the birth of your baby (Partners and future moms are welcome to join as well.)

Registration & Cost: Simply e-mail Kyra and Sofia @ [masked]

http://walktalkyoga.tumblr.com

results.description:
If your looking to go tubing on the Delaware River you have found the right place. Join Twin Rivers Tubing for a fun day of tubing. Right where the Delaware River Meets the Lehigh River. Twin Rivers Tubing trips are approx. 2 to 3 hours. With plenty of beaches to stop and relax on during your float. Kayaking, Pack a lunch and relax on miles of empty beaches along the way. The best Delaware River Tubing around. We offer FREE key check and FREE parking. We provide a customer friendly environment. We really do enjoy getting to know you. Showers, changing rooms and indoor restrooms provided for your convenience. Enjoy a frozen drink on our deck bar overlooking the magnificent Lehigh River waterfalls. Order a delicious meal from the onsite restaurant. You won’t be disappointed. Sit back and relax on Sundays when the Sandbar provides live music.

* Free Parking
* Life jackets provided
* Shuttle service and equipment included in one low price
* No long lines
* Pizzaria/deli & bar and grill on premises
* Pack your own lunch or buy one here
* Deck Bar
* Family owned and operated
* Consumer friendly
* Indoor facilities, changing rooms and outdoor shower
* Beautiful view of the Lehigh River Falls

After tubing, we will have lunch at Twins Rivers Tubing or nearby restaurant.

Departure Date: August 8th Saturday. Please arrive 15 minutes earlier.

Depart 9:15 AM: (Sheraton LaGuardia East Hotel)[masked]th Ave, Flushing, NY 11354 (Map)

Depart 10:00 AM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of West 43rd St. & 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Expect to be back in NYC at 6:00 PM and Flushing at 6:30 PM

Trip Includes: Round Trip Luxury Van Transportation, Tube, and Life Jacket.

Cost: Early Birds $49 for first 8 spots or 14 days in advance; afterward Regular $59

Buy Ticket Here: http://aug2015rivertubing.eventbrite.com/ You can also Chase Quickpay me at [masked] to avoid transaction fee. (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) YOUR SPOT IS NOT CONFIRMED UNTIL YOUR PAYMENT IS RECEIVED.

What to bring: Bottle of water, sunblock, swim wear, towel, sandals, and clothes to change

Maximum: 15

Refund Policy:

* $10 processing fee if cancelled 14 days in advance;
* 50% refund if cancelled 7 days in advance;
* No refund for cancellation or no show within 7 days.

Pictures from Previous Events:
2010: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/999061/
2013: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/16261482/
2014: http://www.meetup.com/NYCAYS/photos/24098432/

For more info: http://www.twinriverstubing.com/

By RSVP'ing "Yes", you and your guest(s) are accepting the terms to the Waiver & Release of Liability set forth by NYC Active Young Singles.

results.description:
We did hiking and BBQ on the same day 2 years ago .  It's time to go back there again this year.  Please join us for hiking and BBQ on same at Watchung Reservation.

The park is located in Scotch Plains and closer for people who live near or in NYC which is about 25 miles.  You also can take NJ Transit bus #114 from the Port Authority Bus Terminal to the intersection of US 22 and New Providence Road in Mountainside: someone will pick you up from there.  Bus will depart at PABT at 8:15 AM on Saturday.

I'm expecting people to leave NYC at around 8:30 a.m. on Saturday. Cars meet at Sky Top Picnic Area which is about 25 miles west of NYC on I-78.   After the hike we will gather for BBQ at the Sky top Picnic area.


The total distance this hike will be 6-10 miles long, depending on the actual route we pick.  After we are done with hiking, we will spend rest of the day relaxing, drinking beers and eatting food (BYOB).


The number of participants is limited only by the number of cars we have to carpool. Please sign up on the waiting list and once we have a car spot for you I'll move you to the "yes" column.

The cost will be moderate - gas & toll money to the drivers ($10-$20 per person) and BBQ after the hike. Please bring enough cash with you to pay both the gas money, cost of the permit and food.

If you have preferences what kind of food to be cooked, please let me know.

I will bring a map, a compass, and a first aid kit. Post a comment or e-mail me if you have any questions.
results.name: Hiking and BBQ same day at Watchung Reservation

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
We have been approved for August 8th at the New location.

Since this is our first meet up, I am setting the time for the meet up between 10am to 8pm. I am not sure how late we could stay in the building. I want to stay on the conservative side for our first meet up.  I want to make the arrival time for 10am. I will probably arrive between 9:15- 9:30. I would like to have sometime to learn the lay of the land.   

The Church is located just off of Easton Ave. ( Landmark: Somerset Diner)

If you are coming from Easton Ave onto JFK Blvd. The church is on your right hand side. It is set back a bit from the street and has some trees in front of it.

The Driveway is on the left side just past the Church building. Please proceed to the back and park all the way to far right of the parking lot.

Our meet up will be held in the meeting room. Please look for Red doors.

I will have the usual beverages and snacks.  Please feel free to bring a snack to share. Meals will be on your own. There is a microwave and a refrigerator.

I will try to get some menus of area restaurants, if some people would like to order out.

There will be two Cricut Expressions/Cartridges and a Big Shot/Die Cuts for your use.

 The cost will be $10.00. I must have 5 member minimum for each meet up.

If we find that members would like to have one catered meal the price of future meet ups will increase. 

I am maintaining the $10 annual fee to cover basic beverages, snacks and supplies. if you are up for renewal or new to the group, please consider paying the fee via paypal ([masked]) or in person at the meet up. Payment could be cash or check (payable to Elisa Bash).

 I will have more detailed info about this meet up closer to the date.

Looking forward to seeing some familiar faces, meeting some new ones as well getting a feel for the new location.

The game format is two 7v7 games, running simultaneously. Winners and losers of the first game will play against each other in the second game.

Fun Play 
No Sliding 
Goals after half point only. 
Kick-ins.. no throw ins. 
Corner kicks. 
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect PS2G plays clean soccer! This means no cursing, insulting, complaining, arguing or fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style or if you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

***BRING TURF SHOES OR SNEAKERS & A DARK, WHITE & A BRIGHT COLORED SHIRT*** 

AGAIN - NO CLEATS ALLOWED!

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free.

http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
We do our summer runs in the morning, because it works better for the school, and it's also cooler in the AMs. Plus, you get to start your day off right! :)

Welcome!


If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games: 1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds. 6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.

results.description:
Join us on Saturday, August 8, 2015 at 10:00 a.m. to hear William K. Schmidt speak to us on the topic of Making Sense Of The GOP Presidential Field. The event will take place in the Library of the Queens Pride House located at[masked]th Avenue, Suite 206, Jackson Heights, New York 11372.

ADMISSION FEE: $5.00 

If you are driving, arrive early to look for free street parking. There are also many 2-hourMuni-Meter spots and a nearby parking lot. 

If you are coming by subway, use the IRT "7" Flushing Line and exit at 74th Street/Broadway. You can also use the IND "E", "F" or "R" Queens Blvd. Lines and exit at the Jackson Heights/Roosevelt Avenue stop.

====================================

This is crazy! There are 16 declared candidates for the Presidential Nomination of the Republican Party. Which ones, if any, are "libertarian" on social and/or economic issues? How can you make sense of this field? Is Trump the anti-politician of the Republican field while Bernie Sanders is the anti-politician of the Democratic field? Is that why they are generating some excitement and even more press? Has Rand Paul's catering to the Christian right undercut his questionable libertarian credentials as he tries to compete with Santorium, Cruz, Huckabee and Walker? Do moderates like Jeb Bush, John Kasich and George Pataki have any chance of winning the nomination? Do you agree that FOX News should be only allowing the TOP TEN GOP Presidential Candidates to enter the debates so early in the process?

Come hear William K. Schmidt speak on these and other issues and afterwards, share your own opinion as well.

=====================================

William K. Schmidt, a libertarian Republican, came very close to being elected Mayor of Peekskill and seriously considered running for the Libertarian Party's Gubernatorial Nomination in 2014. He served as a Peekskill Councilman and on the Westchester County Human Rights Commission. He was a Claims Manager at the NY Liquidation Bureau and is a graduate of St. John's University and Peekskill High School.
results.name: William K. Schmidt on Making Sense Of The GOP Presidential Field

group.name: NYC/Long Island Rand Paul For President 2016 Meetup

results.description:
This is our 3rd soccer practice in preparation for the Supporters Club Cup Tournament at the end of August (a yearly 7v7 competitive tournament among the different supporters clubs based in NYC). The practice will probably consist of some passing and shooting drills and a scrimmage. We will look to have a final roster of about 12-15 players for the tournament, but you must attend at least 2 practices to be considered.


As you probably know, Pier 40 fields are first-come first-serve, so please arrive on time (or earlier if you can). Steven will send an e-mail to the group with our location once we have secured a field.

results.description:
Join us on Saturday, August 8, 2015 at 10:00 a.m. to hear William K. Schmidt speak to us on the topic of Making Sense Of The GOP Presidential Field. The event will take place in the Library of the Queens Pride House located at[masked]th Avenue, Suite 206, Jackson Heights, New York 11372.

ADMISSION FEE: $5.00 

If you are driving, arrive early to look for free street parking. There are also many 2-hourMuni-Meter spots and a nearby parking lot. 

If you are coming by subway, use the IRT "7" Flushing Line and exit at 74th Street/Broadway. You can also use the IND "E", "F" or "R" Queens Blvd. Lines and exit at the Jackson Heights/Roosevelt Avenue stop.

====================================

This is crazy! There are 16 declared candidates for the Presidential Nomination of the Republican Party. Which ones, if any, are "libertarian" on social and/or economic issues? How can you make sense of this field? Is Trump the anti-politician of the Republican field while Bernie Sanders is the anti-politician of the Democratic field? Is that why they are generating some excitement and even more press? Has Rand Paul's catering to the Christian right undercut his questionable libertarian credentials as he tries to compete with Santorium, Cruz, Huckabee and Walker? Do moderates like Jeb Bush, John Kasich and George Pataki have any chance of winning the nomination? Do you agree that FOX News should be only allowing the TOP TEN GOP Presidential Candidates to enter the debates so early in the process?

Come hear William K. Schmidt speak on these and other issues and afterwards, share your own opinion as well.

=====================================

William K. Schmidt, a libertarian Republican, came very close to being elected Mayor of Peekskill and seriously considered running for the Libertarian Party's Gubernatorial Nomination in 2014. He served as a Peekskill Councilman and on the Westchester County Human Rights Commission. He was a Claims Manager at the NY Liquidation Bureau and is a graduate of St. John's University and Peekskill High School.
results.name: William K. Schmidt on Making Sense Of The GOP Presidential Field

results.description:
Here is a very cool hike, a scramble, a hike that is for the experienced hikers/scramblers only. There is a mile of rocky adventure which is not for beginners or those with improper footwear. So....experienced hikers only please. It is billed as 4 hours, 4.5 miles, strenuous by NYNJTC. We did it last year, it was a great hike.

From their description: This loop hike descends the Palisades cliffs, follows a challenging, rocky path along the Hudson River, passes a scenic waterfall, and climbs to reach a panoramic viewpoint over the river.

Scrambling is tricky stuff and sure footing is necessary for this. Please don't sign up if you've never hiked or scrambled before. 

Bring: Snacks, water, change of shirt/shoes, first aid kit, camera. Hiking shoes/boots mandatory. Grippy garden gloves for scrambling. 

We will follow the NYNJTC trip description for this at http://nynjtc.org/hike/giant-stairslong-path-loop-state-line-lookout

GPS coordinates for the State Line Lookout [masked],[masked] I have fixed the embedded map to the Lookout spot.

Driving directions: If you are coming from the north on the Palisades Parkway, bear left just beyond Exit 3 and follow the signs for the State Line Lookout. Follow the access road for about half a mile until it ends at a large parking lot near the lookout. 

From the south take the Palisades Interstate Park north from the George Washington Bridge. Continue for 1.7 miles beyond Exit 2, and turn right at a sign for the State Line Lookout. 

We can carpool from 9W/Cornwall area at 9:15am. Email me if you want to carpool. We will dine afterwards. $2 Meetup fee unless you have over 50 adventures with me. WET ROCKS will possibly postpone things. Rain will definitely postpone. Check your emails for changes. Please send me your cell if I don't have it, I will return with mine, no texts please. All hikes are at your own risk. NO DOGS.
results.name: Giant Stairs/Long Path Loop Hike!!!

results.description:
LEADER: Jeffrey Sovelove ([masked])

RATING: C 5 C

Come take an easy stroll on Patriots Path in Morristown. This 5-mile stroll will start out from the Speedwell Lake parking lot at 10AM across the street from Historic Speedwell. See the Morris County Parks website (www.morrisparks.org/) for directions or put the following address into your preferred map engine: "300 Speedwell Avenue, Morristown NJ 07960". Please bring plenty of water and a light snack. Great for beginners. Heavy/steady rain cancels. Joint ADK/Sierra Club hike.

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance:Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.

results.description:
Updated April 18th, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park on Tuesdays/Thursdays and Morningside Park for the weekend games.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave) 
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!) 
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien 
[masked]


MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
Having a deep and special feeling that comes with connecting to nature has mostly been a private one for me; when I'm in solitude and away from other people.  But what I've found is that with this practice, it's really wonderful to share that connection we all have with nature in a group setting.  It warms me to know that I'm not alone in my experience and that others are tapping into that same wonderful source.  


During our 2-3 hour walks, which are based off of shinrin-yoku (Forest Bathing), I will invite you to participate in a series of sensory connection activities.  A favorite is closing your eyes and walking down the trail (with peeking of course).  There will be ample time for you to privately connect one on one with nature here and there is also time allotted to share your experience if you'd like with the group.  

My fist invitation here is to give yourself the time and opportunity to bring yourself out of the city streets and buildings we occupy much of our time in to join this walk.

I look forward to seeing you there!

*There is a $10 suggested donation at the end of the walks if you are pleased and feel so inclined to offer your financial appreciation.  

Thank you,


DUNCAN

P.S. Please be there on time as I power my phone off at 10:10am.  It's the weekend so take into account the service changes.  Please also keep your RSVPS current, thank you!

P.P.S here is a recent article about my walks.

http://www.nyspirit.com/enviroment/forest-bathing/
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be gathering right at the entrance
results.name: Sharing the Connection

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

http://www.google.com/aclk?sa=l&ai=CbT7Qq1BnVanSCc2ApgOT6oD4A5iQss0GiKiB6ZYB4KnK9qMCCAQQAigFYMnGqYvApNgPoAGYyIbYA8gBB6oEJE_QPn_0wVfREaUxHF1zc8Vdfo8WxmTOJWfipIg-LyMa3y2oksAFBaAGJoAH0Lf5J5AHAagHpr4bqAe...

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916


2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Every time we have a fencing meetup in the park, we meet new people.  Some of them are meetup members who couldn't make meetups at other times, others are just people in the park.  But they're all fun.

Cancellations are much more likely in the summer!  A meetup can be canceled because the ground is too wet, rain is predicted, high heat & humidity are predicted, or just because there aren't enough people committed to being there.  PLEASE RSVP, and come if you say you will. I will post cancellations here by 9am on the day.


To find us, enter the park via the entrance opposite the Ethical Culture School (The Ethical Culture School is on the west side of Central Park West) at 63rd and Central Park West.  The "Backup Fencing Spot" is on your right, just inside the entrance to the park.  Soccer kids have been grabbing our "Where We Fence" location pretty steadily, but to find it, follow the paved path in a large arc to your left, (It starts off heading SE and curves around to NW).  The "Where We Fence" location is on the hard packed dirt under the trees. 


We have a very limited amount of equipment to lend. We're willing to share, but if you have your own equipment, please bring it.

It's also a good idea to bring water!

A more detailed map of where we fence in Central Park is here:

https://maps.google.com/maps/ms?msid=212152258049056562883.0004db7dc1516e1da7244&msa=0&ie=UTF8&t=m&z=17&vpsrc=0

If you're having trouble finding us, call my cell[masked]  It's a good idea to have my cell handy in case we are forced to move.

I look forward to fencing you!

- Mike
results.name: Free Saturday Fencing in Central Park

results.description:
The Cremaster is the notorious series of films that made Matthew Barney super extra famous.  http://www.cremaster.net/#
http://www.pbs.org/art21/artists/matthew-barney

This series runs all day, but you are welcome to drop in when you like.  If you would like to see all 5 Cremasters but cannot do it in one day, know that there will be multiple showings of the series.

The CREMASTER cycle, created and produced by Matthew Barney, is a series of five visually extravagant films made out of sequence (CREMASTER 4 began the cycle, followed by CREMASTER 1, 5, 2, and finally, CREMASTER 3) but presented here in the order of their creation. The title of the cycle refers to the muscle that raises and lowers the male reproductive system according to external stimuli such as temperature or fear. Taken in sequential order, the films correlate to the height of the gonads during the embryonic process of sexual differentiation, with CREMASTER 1 representing the most “ascended” state, and CREMASTER 5 the most “descended.”

As the cycle evolved over eight years (1994–2002), this biological model was joined by other paradigms such as history, autobiography and mythology that have added to Barney’s fantastical narrative constructs. The resulting cosmology is both beautiful and complex, with densely layered and interconnected symbols and images.

The films are screened here in chronological order of their production to reveal the development of Barney’s relationship to the material and of his creative process.

Schedule
10:30 am, CREMASTER 4 (1994), 41 min.
11:15 am, CREMASTER 1 (1995), 42 min.
12:15 pm, CREMASTER 5 (1997), 55 min.
2:45 pm, CREMASTER 2 (1999), 80 min.
4:30 pm, CREMASTER 3 (2002), 178 min.

Free with museum admission.

For detailed info on the series follow these links
http://www.guggenheim.org/new-york/calendar-and-events/2015/06/06/the-cremaster-cycle/4787
http://www.cremaster.net/

For admission hours and location follow this link http://www.guggenheim.org/new-york/visit

venue.name: meet at Battery Maritime Building

results.description:
This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's New York Social Network and a dozen of their partner Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP's listed on this Meet Up reflect only a portion of those actually attending.  If you want to know the exact number of people coming or have any other questions contact [masked].

Governors Island is one of the most interesting places to visit in NYC.  It was once home to Native American tribes, then Dutch and British settlements, a strategic part of the American Revolution and the home for the U.S. Coast Guard for many years.  Now the island is a historic goldmine that offers spectacular views of Manhattan and much more.  Join a group of NYSN members and friends as we travel to the island together, head to the famous island food square then enjoy special guided tour of the historic area of the island given by a Nation Parks Ranger.  You will have a chance to discover the historic Fort Jay and other amazing sites. 

The group will travel over together on the 11:am ferry.  From there you will explore parts of the island that include fascinating old houses that were once lived in by Generals and Majors, a trip to Hammock Grove and then lunch at the picnic area with top rated gourmet food trucks. Following the lunch you will enjoy a guided tour through history given by a Governors Island expert!  Following the tour you can return to NYC with the group, stay on the island to explore on your own, rent a bike, see the art exhibits.

How do I get there? Meet the group at the Battery Maritime Building at 10 South Street on the corner of South and Whitehall Streets in Lower Manhattan and next door to the Staten Island ferry terminal at 10:30am sharp.  Here is a link for the building:  Battery Maritime Building

How will find the group?  The leader will have an NYSN/Meet up Sign and will be standing just outside or inside of the ferry terminal entrance glass doors..  When you register you will also be sent an email the morning of with the cell phone contact of the person hosting the group. 

What should I wear? Summer clothes, comfortable shoes, sunblock

What should I bring? bottled water/camera. Bring your own lunch or buy from a food truck

What if it rains? We will make a decision to go ahead or cancel the tour based on the forecast.  Refunds will be given only if the tour does not happen.

Can I invite a friend?  Most will come on their own but if you wish to invite a guest, please choose as many tickets as you would like.

What is included:  The tour, park donation, ferry, guide fee

How can I pay? Please bring exact change ($15) as that help speed up the check in process.

What to expect: 30-40 fun and friendly people ages 20's - 40's 

Why should I go on this tour? Because you have never been to Governors Island or have been there and do not know the history.  Because you want to enjoy a nice day out of the city at an amazing place with beautiful views or  because you have nothing better to do this afternoon!
results.name: Governors Island History Tour:  Explore, Socialize & Eat!

results.description:
The meetup point is at the Chase Bank.
We will hike to the races and then disperse so you can view all the on going events on you own. You can also remain with the organizers if you wish for a return to the original meet point. These races are happening in a Carnival atmosphere. There are many events, vendors, sponsor booths. and happenings at the same time and several thousand people there at this time. It is impossible to stay together under these conditions so you are free to roam about the lake area on your own or you can stay with the organizers, however, the races last for a few hours so you may want to leave at your convenience.
It will take about 45 minutes to 1 hour to get to the event. Distance for a round trip back to Kew Gardens is about 5 or so miles.
This is an annual event held at the lake in the park with the participants winning prizes running into several thousand dollars.
.There is an optional donation of $!.00 requested to attend this meetup event.
CYA there!

results.description:
Here's the idea: come join other NYC developers for a peer-based learning lab. You've got a question? Maybe someone can provide you with some insight. Maybe you can help someone else. Bring a laptop and some code to work on.

We'll have coffee, cereal, and lunch at the end.
results.name: CocoaPods Peer Lab

results.description:
Come, join this free session and learn the fundamentals of practicing yoga. This class is good for a beginner or anyone who is looking to take a gentle yoga class, and have some fun while doing it!

There will be a short introduction in the beginning explaining what yoga is and how it works, followed by light stretching, breathing exercises, and meditation.

All you need to bring is:

- some loose fitting clothing- that you can comfortable move in

- an empty stomach- no food preferably 2-3 hours before class

You may bring your own yoga mat if you have one. If not, we have mats here that you can use.

Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

-Komal
results.how_to_find_us: Cross street is Newark Ave. and it is 2 blocks away from Journal Square PATH station
results.name: Fundamentals of Yoga- Sat, Aug 8th @ 10:30am

results.description:
** Thurs, Aug 6th Update - An email was sent out earlier in the week asking members to reconfirm RSVPs by sending me a Meetup message or email message.  If you haven't done so, please do so on Thurs, Aug 6th or Fri, Aug 7th.  I will not be able to see postings on Saturday (I have a retro cell phone) until I return home.  

Some members  will stay in the city afterwards to attend a show at the Armory on Park Ave ($22 general admission ticket) :

http://www.armoryonpark.org/programs_events/detail/UCS_taylor_mac_machine_dazzle 

If you are interested in attending the theatre performance, please pre-purchase a ticket online.  

We plan to head back to the city by the shuttle bus and #7 train after attending the Dragon Boat Festival. 

Thanks!

**

Let's adventure to an Asian sporting event without stepping on a plane!  

We'll cheer on 180 dragon boat teams from around the world racing in Flushing Meadow Corona Park's Lake during the 25th Hong Kong Dragon Boat Festival.  

There's live entertainment, cultural demonstrations and traditional foods (for purchase) to enjoy. A truly special NYC Free Event.

For more information about this festival please see 

Dragon Boat Festival Link

Facebook Dragon Festival Link


Write up of 2014 Festival 

In this park you will also find the 1964/65 New York World's Fair Uniglobe. With a diameter of 120 feet it's the largest of its kind globally. 

  Those using Metro North should meet at an agreed time on the train.  I have written the organizers for help to identify a second meeting point at the Festival .

If you are taking Metro North to Grand Central , take the #7 train to Mets-Willets Point Station. Take the special event bus to the park.  

This is a day trip, however one could easily turn this into a staycation by booking a local hotel in Queens, NY & attend the 2nd day of the festival or other local events/attractions.

Please consider contributing to the operating expense of this Meetup which includes the $14.95 monthly web fee. Chip in at an upcoming meeting or using the green chip in button on the left side of our home page.  Thank you.
results.name: Daycation - Dragon Boat Festival in NYC
